Ronnie is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure, seeds of rice to be planted in his three hectares of farm and herbicides to protect his crops. 

He wants to improve and expand his business to increase his income, thus providing a better future for his family. He also dreams that his child could finish his studies and be able to get a good job someday. That's why he really works hard to become successful in his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Pedro Rafael

texts.en:
Pedro lives in Choluteca, Honduras, where for the last eight years he has made a living by selling plastic goods, paper plates and cups, and flatware. 

Pedro sells his wares at a stand at the local market and has a large web of clients that includes local hotels and restaurants. 

He is requesting a loan of HNL 10,000 to purchase merchandise. Pedro hopes to keep working with Prisma in order to grow his small business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic bowls, buckets, strainers, cups, plates and flatware.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  She is 33 years old and a single mother of three school going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of Kshs 10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Milkah hopes to become one of the leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Dedicacion

texts.es:
Dedicación, de 45 años, enviudo hace dos años de su esposo Maurilio. Ambos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2 de ellas: Nora y Candí. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ricrican.
Está valerosa mujer, se dedica a la siembra de tubérculos en la variedad de, papa, oyuco y oca, lo que más le gusta a ella, son los momentos en los que puede bajar de sus terrenos agrícolas a la ciudad, donde después de cada cosecha vende sus productos alimenticios, según cuenta comercializa a muy buen precio, pues cuida con mucho esmero de sus cultivos, escogiendo siempre los frutos más buenos. Ella baja por lo menos una vez a la ciudad de Tarma, donde aparte de vender sus nutritivos tubérculos, también comercializa carne de ovino al por mayor, con la venta puede costear los alimentos de la semana y algunos imprevistos. Ella agradece a Dios, por todo el apoyo que recibió y a pesar de lo pesado que es trabajar en la chacra, está feliz de poder tener algo propio y trabajarlo para sus hijos.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mirando a un futuro mejor” y este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde seguirá trabajando para el desarrollo de su banco comunal, además; como socia antigua promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Dedicación de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para preveer su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
45-year-old Dedicación is a widow.  She lost her husband Maurilio two years ago.  The couple had five children but Dedicación only lives with two of them: Nora and Candí.  They live together as a family unit in their own home which is located in the town of Ricrican.

This brave woman grows tubers (potatoes, oyuco and oca).  What she most enjoys is when she is able to travel down from her farm to the city where she sells her produce after each harvest.  She tells us that she is able to sell at a very good price because she takes a lot of care of her crops, always choosing the best fruit.  She travels at least once to the city of Tarma where, in addition to selling her nutritious tubers, she also sells meat from her sheep.  These sales enable her to cover the cost of her weekly food and some other incidental expenses.

Dedicación is grateful to God for all the support that she has received and, in spite of how demanding it is working on her farm, she is happy that she owns her farm and is able to work it for her children.

Dedicación belongs to the "Mirando a un futuro mejor" community bank and this is her 12th loan from MFP.  She will continue working for the development of her bank.  As a long-standing member of her bank, Dedicación pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments.  With your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of natural fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of natural fertilizers

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is aged 31 and has been farming in the Kitale area of western Kenya for 10 years. He is married with two children aged 7 and 1. He does timber lumbering for additional income. His farm produces milk and timber for the local market.

Kennedy has requested a loan of 41,600 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the additional dairy income will boost his income and enable him to buy more farm implements and a power saw for the lumbering business.

Kennedy sees the lack of business funds and animal diseases as the greatest threats to his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Katina Sarita

texts.es:
Katina es socia del Banco Comunal Unión, tiene 36 años, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Katina tiene un locutorio y vende tarjetas telefónicas, empezó vendiendo queso por menor y mayor de ahí fue creciendo con sus ahorros, en las capacitaciones le enseñaron muchos valores y a poder ahorrar ya que en la casa no se puede, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando va a comprar mas tarjetas y recargas para su negocio. Su meta es seguir esforzándose y progresar.
texts.en:
Katina is a member of the communal bank Unión. She is 36 years old and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 5 years. 

Katina has a communications call center and sells phone cards. She began by selling cheese, in small amounts and bulk, and from there her savings grew. During training they taught her business ethics and she was able to save, which she could not do by staying at home.

Now she is asking for a loan to buy more telephone cards and recharges for her business. Her goal is to continue her efforts and to progress.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William wants a loan to buy cows for rearing. 

Age 53 years, he hails from the Kyenjojo district and is the father of ten children age 30 to 2 with whom he lives, together with their mother, in a semi- permanent house. 

Having acquired his initial capital from the sale of part of his land, he has been a able to set up a cattle farm. 

He dreams of building a permanent residential house and diversifying into sugarcane growing.

loans.use: to buy another cow.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan, necesita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más sorbetes, paleta, gaseosa, para el negocio, debido a la necesidad de surtir el negocio y contar con nueva mercadería, es que Juan se decidió por el nuevo financiamiento. 
El préstamo anterior le sirvió para inyectar nuevo producto al negocio, mejorando considerablemente las ventas y de sus ganancias pudo cancelar cada cuota del préstamo, ha logrado ofrecer a su familia una mejor condición económica y espera continuar de esta manera.
texts.en:
Juan needs a new loan to buy more sorbets, popsicles and soft drinks, because of the need to stock his business and have new merchandise. 

This is why Juan made up his mind to apply for a new loan. He used the previous loan to put new products into his business, improving his sales considerably.  From his earnings, he was able to pay each instalment of the loan, and has succeeded in improving his family's financial situation. 

This way, he hopes to continue doing so.

loans.use: To buy sorbets, popsicles and soft drinks.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one school-aged child. He has owned a car repair shop since 1999. His job consists of repairing vehicle bodies. He has one full-time employee helping him with the work. He cooperates with his wife who works in selling shoes and electrical products in order to pay the whole family expenses, especially their child's educational fees. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more car spare parts. In the future, he plans to open a bigger store and trade in spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase more car spare parts.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a 27-year-old married woman, who has three children. Her husband works for the security department in Al Karak. Walaa opened a small shop to sell home products and items, mostly kitchen tools such as cups, plates, trays, etc. It has been six years now since she started, and her business is running smoothly. 

Now Walaa has applied for a loan to add more items to her store, so she can cover most home products needed besides kitchen items.

loans.use: to add more items to her home products store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Grace works in the fish industry and sells and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fishing accessories like hooks and pay for gasoline and maintenance for her fishing boat. 

Grace has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Grace hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing accessories like hooks and pay for gasoline and maintenance for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Espuma De Mar Group

texts.es:
El grupo está conformado por mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsable todas viven en diferentes lugares sin embargo las integrantes del grupo se reunieron en la casa de doña Socorro, ya que por problemas de salud no pude salir, no puede caminar porque los doctores  le han indicado que debe tomar reposo por dos meses, mientras tanto las integrantes del grupo se reunirán en la casa de la señora Socorro, el lugar donde vive es en una lomita donde todas las mañanas el sol les llega primero, esto es lo que cuenta la señora doña Socorro.
El grupo se llama "Espuma de Mar" bueno el nombre lo eligieron porque solo se les ocurrió también porque lo han utilizado en otros créditos grupales.
Doña Caro quien es la representante del grupo tiene 28 años está casada con el señor Gustavo quien trabaja de cajero juntos han procreado 2 hijos Jaime de 9 años de edad el cursa cuarto año de primaria y Leslie de 4 años está en segundo de preescolar.
Doña Caro se dedica y a la crianza de pollos los compra cuando son pequeños para luego venderlos cuando ya son grandes cometa que en dicha actividad lleva ya 4 años en los cuales no presenta gran dificultad solo cuando estos enferman pero para esto la señora Caro los lleva al veterinario así que no hay gran dificultad.
Esta vez ella ha solicitado el crédito para comprar 150 pollos chicos, maíz y el alimento su meta con sus pollos que próximamente comprara es que crezcan pronto dentro de tres meses y venderlos para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la escuela y del hogar, también quiere ahorrar  algo de dinero para cuando su esposo se quede sin trabajo tengan de donde comer ya que comento " Es muy difícil cuando mi esposo Gustavo no trabaja porque no tenemos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de nuestros hijos, como alimentación, calzados, útiles de la escuela, es por eso que yo y todas las integrantes del grupo estamos muy agradecidas por otorgarnos el crédito es la primera vez que estamos y no pensamos quedar mal y menos yo ya que como representante debo de poner el ejemplo"
Las restantes del grupo invertirán el préstamo para otras actividades como: Doña Francisca, la señora Juana y doña Socorro compraran pollos para criarlos y luego venderlos, la señora Maribel invertirá en ropa interior, Doña Cinthya invertirá en la venta de catálogos de colchas y fragancias finalmente Brisa invertirá en sus negocio de Colchas y zapatos.
texts.en:
This group is made up of very hardworking, responsible women who all live in different places but the group members meet in Socorro’s house because due to health issues she’s unable to go out; she can’t walk because the doctors have recommended that she rest for two months so the group members will meet in her house.  The place where she lives is on a little hill where every morning the sun arrives first, this is what Socorro relates.

The group is called “Espuma de Mar” (Sea Foam).  They chose this name because it occured to them and also because it’s been used in other communal banks.  

Caro, 28, is the group representative.  She’s married to Gustavo who works as a cashier and they have two children: Jaime, 9, attending fourth grade in elementary school and Leslie, 4, in second grade of preschool.

Caro raises chickens that she buys when they are little and then sells when they are big.  She comments that she’s been in this business four years and has no great difficulty except when they become ill but if that happens Caro takes them to the veterinarian so there’s no big problem.

On this occasion she’s asked for the loan to buy 150 chicks, corn and feed.  Her goal for the chicks she’ll soon buy is that they grow soon so that she can sell them within three months to help her husband with schooling and household expenses.  She also wants to save up some money so that when her husband is out of work they will still be able to eat.  She comments: “It’s very difficult when my husband, Gustavo, isn’t working because we don’t have what’s needed to cover our children’s basic needs like food, shoes, school supplies.  That’s why I and the other group members are very grateful for the loan we are being granted.  This is our first time and we don’t intend to disappoint, especially me who as group representative must set the example.”

The other group members will use the loan for other activities like:  Francisca, Juana and Socorro will buy chicks to raise and later sell; Maribel will buy underwear; Cinthya will invest in catalogue comforters and fragrances and finally, Brisa will invest in her bedspread and shoe business.

loans.use: to buy 150 chicks, feed and corn.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with two children; one attends school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her major dream is to establish real estate houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, 33 and the mother of four children, works hard to generate income for the family by farming rice with her husband. Now that the rainy-season rice has just been harvested, she will start work for the dry season that is arriving soon.

Neang is requesting a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers, rice seeds and lubricating oil to prepare for the new season. In the future, she hopes to own a large farm upon which to grow her crops and raise poultry.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine, fertilizers, rice seeds and lubricating oil.

loans.name: Rosa Herminia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa esta solicitando un crédito para arreglar el interior de la vivienda, que es comprar el material que es cemento,pintura para el interior y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la mejora; con el cual mejorar el aspecto de la casa, anteriormente solicito un crédito con nosotros para ampliar la parte alta a un no ha terminado en su totalidad pero quiere terminar primero la parte baja y así terminar los cuartos de la planta alta. 

Doña Rosa trabaja toda la semana en la vecina ciudad y su esposo trabaja registrando carros, y ambos forman una familia de cuatro hijos dos de ellos, ya están casados y tiene su propia familia y los otros dos están en la etapa escolar, por lo cuales se esfuerzan en sus trabajos para poderles brindarles lo mejor posible y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is asking for a loan to improve the interior of her house. She will buy cement and paint and pay workers who will make the improvements. She requested a previous loan with us to expand the second floor and hasn’t finished it completely but wants to first finish the ground floor and then complete the rooms upstairs.

Rosa works all week in the neighboring city and her husband works registering cars; they both form a family with four children.  Two of the children are already married and have their own families and the other two are still attending school so they work hard at their jobs to be able to provide them with the best possible and to improve their lives.

loans.use: to do some interior home improvements.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old business woman whose husband is a retired military officer. They are blessed with six children of ages between three to 23 years of age.

She has been a distributor of household goods for two years and the business earns her a basic monthly income of Kshs 3,000. She requires a loan of Kshs 5,000 that she would use to buy more merchandise to boost her business. 

Hellen’s hopes and dreams are to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To  buy more merchandise goods for sale to boost her home products business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena, de 56 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, además de ser muy amable y trato jovial. Está casada con Roberto quien es artesano y padre de sus 2 hijos Wilson de 26 años y Neri de 19 años de edad.  Vive en compañía de su esposo, hijos mas sus 2 nietos, instalados en su propia casa. El negocio que tiene Elena  es la venta de abarrotes en general y yucas, para eso abrió una bodega en su propia casa atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes. 
Empezó con un apoyo financiero de MFP, comprando en pequeñas cantidades, logrando crecer a base de esfuerzo, realizándola ella sola. Iniciándose hace más de 6 meses contando con el apoyo de su hijo en la atención al público consumidor.
Considera su negocio rentable por la ganancias que le deja, pues cuenta con una regular clientela.
Su negocio le permite estar en casa para poder atender a su pequeño hijo, así como los ingresos económicos que le sirven para comprar lo que le falte para su hogar, al contrario no le gusta que algunos de sus clientes le piden crédito y cuando llega el momento del pago se retrasan. Por tanto tiene deseos de  crecer y ampliar su bodega hasta convertirla en un bazar donde pueda vender toda clase de productos. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues conoce a la mayoría, aun existe el ingreso de algunos nuevos, espera que sean responsables como el resto del grupo. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes al por mayor para su bodega, como azúcar, arroz, aceites y otros. También de yucas ya que los precios de éste producto están al alza, dejándole mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elena, age 56, is a cheerful and hard-working woman, and she also has a very kind and jovial manner.  She is married to Roberto, a craftsman and father of their two children.  Wilson is 26 years old, and Neri is 19 years old.  She lives with her husband, her children, and two grandchildren in her own house.

Elena’s business is selling general groceries.  She opened a grocery store in her house in order to do this.  She also sells yuccas, and she kindly tends to her customers.  She started with financial support from MFP.  She purchased in small quantities, and she managed to grow from the foundation of hard work.  Over the time that she had her business she worked alone.  However, starting over six month ago she counts on her son’s help in waiting on the public.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the income it gives her, and because she has a regular clientele.  Her business allows her to be at home in order to be able to tend to her young child.  The financial income serves her to buy what she needs for her household.  On the other hand, she does not like that some of her customers ask for credit.  When it comes time to pay they put it off.  Even so, she sees that her business is well-received.  Therefore, she wishes to grow and expand her grocery store until she can convert it into a bazaar where she will be able to sell all types of products.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She hopes for your collaboration so that she will be able to firm up her plans.  Also, she feels good with her communal bank.  She knows most of them, and new members are joining.  She hopes they will be as responsible as the rest of the group.  She will use the requested 2000 soles to buy wholesale groceries like sugar, rice, oil, and others for her grocery store.  She will also buy yuccas because the prices for this product are rising, which leaves her with greater income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, oil, and yucca.

loans.name: Copaboka 1 Group

texts.fr:
Madame Véronique, membre du groupe COPABOKA 1, âgé de 54 ans, cultivatrice du riz,  a 10 enfants dont le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 8 ans. 8 de ses enfants vont à l'école et n'a aucune autre personne en sa charge. Véronique a 3 ans de l'école familiale.
Elle est devenue cliente de l'ACB en 2011 est le cycle actuel est le deuxième. Le crédit sollicité sera utilisé pour acheter les engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle va utiliser la stratégie d’utiliser la semence sélectionnée pour accroitre son activité agricole. Avec le profit, elle va éduquer et faire soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Véronique, a member of the "Capoboka 1" group, is 54 years old and a rice farmer. She has 10 children, the eldest of whom is 30 and the youngest, 8. 8 of her children go to school and she is responsible for no other people. Véronique has 3 years of education at a family school.

She became a customer of ACB in 2011 and is currently on her second loan cycle. The loan being requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers. Her strategy will be to use selected seeds in order to expand her farming business. She will use the profits for her children's education and health care.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and pay the labourers.

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Progreso Group

texts.es:
Doña Francisca es un de las integrantes de Banco Mujer En Progreso, tiene 69 años, es soltera y vive con una hija y sus nietos. Comerciante desde hace muchos, se dedica a la venta de productos de catálogos, y utensilios de cocina. Los ingresos generados producto de esta actividad es la única de entrada de dinero con la que cuenta Doña Francisca. Los créditos han sido de gran ayuda ya que le permiten invertir en mercadería para atender los pedidos de sus clientes, y aumentar sus clientes. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita y será invertido en la compra de mercadería, como cosméticos, perfumes, y artículos de cocina, aprovechando las ventas de la temporada navideña. Para Doña Francisca su edad no es impedimento para seguir trabajando con todas las fuerzas, entusiasmo, y principalmente con el objetivo de no ser una carga para su familia, por el contrario poder ayudar con los gastos de su hija y nietos.   
Junto a ella integran el grupo 3 señoras que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y de servicios.
texts.en:
Francisca is one of the members of the Banco Mujer En Progreso.  She is 69 years old and single.  She lives with her daughter and her grandchildren.  She has been a merchant for many years.  She sells catalog products and kitchen utensils.  The income generated by this business activity is the only income that Francisca has.

The loans have been a big help.  They allow her to invest in merchandise to tend to her customers’ orders, and to increase her number of customers.

This is the third loan she has requested.  She will use it to buy merchandise like cosmetics, perfumes, and kitchen items.  She will be taking advantage of the Christmas sales.

Her age is not an impediment to Francisca to continue working with all her strength and enthusiasm.  Her primary objective in doing so is to not be a burden to her family.  To the contrary, she is able to help with her daughter’s and grandchildren’s expenses.

Three women join her in the group, and they will invest in commercial business activities and services.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes, and kitchen items.

loans.name: Dhanai

texts.en:
Dhanai is a 29-year-old lady living with her mother and child. She manages a tailoring shop where she sews dresses like salwars (traditional Indian dress) etc. for her customers who give orders for sewing. After her husband left her, she was burdened with her child's responsibilities so she started a tailoring shop. She earns only 5,000 INR per month from this business. She has planned to purchase two new sewing machines so that she can enlarge her business and take orders from her customers in bulk. 

Dhanai has requested a loan of 36,000 INR to purchase two sewing machines and fabrics. She also wants to hire some workers to help her. She wants her child to study in a good school and save some money for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase two sewing machine and fabrics for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: El Encanto Group

texts.es:
El olor a caña quemada, el silbido del ingenio, el tizne, el pitido de los carros que transporta a las cuadrillas de cortadores a las 5 de la mañana, son las pruebas de que la zafra ha dado inicio y con ello aumenta el fluido económico pues la comunidad pertenece a una zona cañera.
En uno de los barrios del municipio se formó el grupo "el encanto" nombre que eligieron los integrantes pues les encantan sus actividades.
JUAN - hot dog y hamburguesas
Carlos - Cosméticos 
Mirna - Producto Naturista 
Karla -Masajes 
Jorge, Luis -Chacharas
Feliza - Lavandería 
Maria- Carnicería 
Doña Feliza es una de las integrantes del grupo, todos le conocen por su nombre y los más allegados a ella le llaman la abuela de cariño, tiene 71 años de edad , doña Feliza es madre de 6 hijos todos ellos mayores de edad, provenientes de Chacal tianguis llegaron a la comunidad en busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y fue así como en conjunto con su esposo iniciaron con una pequeña carnicería la cual ofrecía servicio de 6 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde, era atendida por ella y su esposo, a las 6 de la tarde doña Felisa ya estaba en su pequeña refresquería ubicada en el parque donde permanecía de 6 de la tarde a 10 de la noche, de la misma manera su esposo tenían un billar el cual era atendido por un empleado "recuerdo que mis hijos salían a entregar los tamales, longaniza, rellena y carnitas a nuestros clientes y fue así como les inculcamos el gusto por el comercio" expreso con una gran sonrisa en el rostro.
Hace 16 años al faltar su esposo doña Feliza traspaso los negocios a sus hijos y ella puso en casa una pequeña carnicería la cual permaneció activa por dos años pues quien mataba los marranos y preparaba las carnitas decidió ir en busca del sueño americano y fue así como ella decidió iniciar hace 14 años con su pequeña lavandería donde pasa en promedio 5 horas al día con el fin de entregar a tiempo la ropa a sus clientes, los prestamos han significado para ella una oportunidad de crecimiento pues le han permitido comprar lavadoras, detergente, secadoras, tendederos, pinzas y dar manteamiento a las que tiene, "quiero transformar mi lavandería e incorporar máquinas de las que hay en la ciudad donde agregas u a moneda para el lavado exprés así poder atender a más clientes" comentó contenta.
En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de una secadora pues con el cambio de clima y las lluvias repentinas necesita de una nueva secadora para darse abasto y entregar la ropa seca, col olor a suavitel y que sus clientes la sigan prefiriendo.
“dios los bendiga por cada préstamo que nos han brindado, por creer en nosotros y apoyarnos para seguir adelante con nuestras actividades, de todo corazón gracias” son las palabras de los integrantes del grupo.
La fotografía fue tomada en el espacio donde don juan prepara las hamburguesas, hot dog  con ayuda de su esposa, detrás está el cuarto de lavado de doña Feliza quien viste traje floreado

loans.use: Comprara 1 secadora

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND FARMING

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa has a small plot of land that she bought about 30 years ago. She lives on the land with her son and his family of three children. They primarily plant rice, but also raise chickens and pigs as a secondary source of income. She hopes to invest the money in making her production greater by buying fertilizer. With her extra income she also wants to help her grandchildren go to school and hopefully make more investments in her land.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large mulitnational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by the small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soy beans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soy beans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice farming

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: A. Ruslan is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Nagorno-Karabakh, which he left in 2003. He is married with one child. He purchased a cow some time ago but his poor financial situation has prevented him  from buying a calf to expand his business. Therefore, he has applied to Aqroinvest CU and borrowed 1200 USD  to buy another cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana María A. is 58 years old. She has been separated for 20 years. She has 4 children: 3 sons of 36, 31, and 28 that work and live in Argentina (neighboring country). The youngest, a daughter, is 26 years and lives with her mother. She works in an import business and she helps her mother with the household expenses.

Ana tells us that she used to lived with her children in Argentina, but that she decided to return to Paraguay 15 years ago with her youngest daughter. With her modest savings, she opened a grocery store in her home, where she sells all kinds of basic needs products like rice, sugar, oil, flour, diary, meat, etc.

Ana also told us that thanks to a previous loan from the Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to grow and strengthen her business. At this point, Ana is requesting a new loan that she plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of sugar, flour, and meat. With this, she will be able to obtain good discounts and increase her profit margin.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Original description in Spanish:

La señora Ana María A. tiene 58 años, ella es separada hace ya 20 años, ella tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos son varones y tienen 36, 31 y 28 respectivamente, ellos trabajan y viven en la Argentina (país limítrofe), la más pequeña tiene 26 años vive con su madre y trabaja en una empresa de importaciones y apoya a su madre con los gastos de la casa.

Ana nos comenta que anteriormente vivía con sus hijos en Argentina, pero hace 15 años tomó la decisión de volver a Paraguay junto con su hija menor. Con unos pocos ahorros que pudo juntar, ella abrió una despensa en su casa, donde comercializa todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, tales como arroz azúcar, aceite, harina, lácteos, carnes etc.

Ana nos cuenta que gracias a préstamos obtenidos anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo ver crecer y fortalecer su negocio. Hoy, Ana está solicitando un nuevo crédito que lo desea invertir en compra al por mayor de azúcar, harina y carne pues con eso podrá obtener importantes descuentos y aumentar su margen de ganacias.

loans.use: wholesale purchase of sugar, flour, and meat

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia is 33 years old and has two young children. From her youth, Zonia has worked various jobs, always looking for ways to help support her family. Unfortunately, she encountered some difficulties that prevented her from working as effectively as before. Finally, 4 months ago, with the undying support of her loving sister-in-law, she decided to start selling ice creams in far-away towns and forgotten places in Juliaca, the area where she lives. She has dedicated much time and energy to earn great sums of money for her family's well-being. She would like to buy a freezer so she can preserve products and efficiently run her business. Therefore, she seeks $275 and requests her generous lenders to wait the short time until she is able to materialize her wish. She promises to be punctual and to repay the loan in no more than 6 months. With your collaboration, you will be able help her overcome the obstacles and warmly renew her hopes for progress.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Zonia tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de dos pequeños niños y se ha dedicado desde muy joven a diversas actividades comerciales, siempre en busca del progreso y éxito de su familia; sin embargo desafortunadamente encontró muchos obstáculos que no le permitieron desenvolverse eficazmente en su vida laboral. Finalmente hace 4 meses, con el apoyo incondicional de su amorosa suegra decidió comercializar helados en los pueblos más lejanos y olvidados de la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, labor a la que le dedica mayor tiempo y esfuerzo y con el que viene generando importantes sumas de dinero para el sustento y bienestar de su familia.Su deseo es adquirir una máquina congeladora que utilizará con el propósito de conservar sus productos y fortalecer su negocio, para esto solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares y recurre a los infinitos generosos corazones a fin de concretar su anhelo en corto tiempo, además promete ser puntual y devolver el préstamo en un lapso no mayor a 6 meses.Con tu colaboración congelará los obstáculos y abrigará nuevas esperanzas de progreso en su corazón.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Orfelina De Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Orfelina de Jesus is a member of the Creative Women’s Communal Bank. She sells bakery products in the Moyobamba food market, where she also sells long coriander, green onions, avocados, lettuce, aromatic herbs, etc. She offers fruit, including papaya and bananas, honey, and medicinal plants such as noni,(also called Great Morinda) jagua (also called Huito), etc. She also sells beans, and a variety of flowers, taking advantage of whatever is in season. Having been taught business skills by her mother since she was a child, she decided to open a business. She was brought up with a desire to earn her own income - to grow as a person and a woman, and by doing so provide support in paying the household bills. With the most recent loan from Manuela Ramos, which she will fulfill in 6 payments, she will purchase bulk beans, banana clusters, bulk honey, and large quantities of regional fruits, including papaya, coconut, noni, along with other products that she has needed to purchase almost daily, including long coriander, green onions, Chinese cabbage, lettuce, avocados, yucca, etc. To maintain her clientele, she makes sure that her stand is in order and that the product that she offers is fresh. She has 6 children and is 61 years old. Nearly all of her children anre independent now, and she now only supports the youngest. She enjoys her daily activities in her home, and her work in market, now that she has established a strong clientele by offering quality products. Her goal is to have her business in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Orfelina de Jesús pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas, se dedica la venta de productos de pan llevar en el mercado de abastos de Moyobamba, en donde ella ofrece desde verduras como culantro, cebolla china, paltas, lechuga, yerbas aromáticas, etc; también vende frutas como papaya, plátanos, así mismo vende miel de abeja, plantas medicinales como el Noni, jagua, etc. Complementa su negocio con menestras de toda variedad y flores, ella aprovecha los productos que están en temporada de producción. Decidió iniciarse en este negocio por que desde pequeña su mamá le enseño algunas habilidades para el negocio y también generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer, y así aportar económicamente en los gastos de su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 cuotas, comprará menestras en sacos, plátano en racimos, grandes cantidades de miel de abeja, frutas de la región en grandes cantidades como papaya, cocona, noni y los demás productos que tiene que comprar casi a diario como culantro, cebolla china, col china, lechuga, paltas, yucas, etc. que pone a la venta todos los días, para mantener a su clientela ella tiene que surtir bien su puesto y vender productos en buen estado. Tiene 61 años y 6 hijos, casi todos ya independientes, en la actualidad sólo la última está a su cargo quien le apoya en sus actividades diarias, en la venta en el mercado y en las actividades de la casa, está contenta con lo que hace, porque disfruta de ello ya que tiene sus clientes seguros por la calidad de los productos que vende, su meta es tener su propio negocio en su propia casa .

loans.use: Purchase of bulk beans, fruit, aromatic herbs, honey, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 26 and married with two children. For the past four years, he has owned a welding shop. Welding is a good trade as there is always a need for quality welders. Most shops operate as small businesses alongside the roadways and can easily hire 2-3 additional workers. This is the type of business where once you are established, you will always stay busy. Many businesses that open require no trained skill, i.e. produce stands, and exist only temporarily as long as the operator shows up. With welding, you have a viable business that can even be handed down to your children or sold for a profit.

Charles is a very talented welder who enjoys his trade. With time, he can build a strong clientele. With his loan he plans to buy more metal and oil for his welding machine. His loan is relatively small, but he is new to his lending group. He will need to show that he is capable of repayment before he can acquire a larger loan. In lending groups, the group is responsible for the repayment of any member who defaults; consequently, they have the final say as to who will be a member and how large a loan each member should receive.

loans.use: To buy more metal and oil for his workshop.

loans.name: Acholi B Group

texts.en:
Betty is 27 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a civil servant. Betty, Jesca, Mary and Florence all have stone Quarrying businesses. With the extra business profits, Betty wants to buy a piece of land. Aminah has a beauty salon and wants to use the loan to buy more salon equipment.
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To re-invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Som

texts.en: Mrs. Som B., who is 53, is married with five children and works as a housewife cooking food for her family. She also owns a plot of land growing a variety of crops which everyday allows her to earn a little less than $1 per day . Her husband works as a security guard at the Bayon temple and makes about $1 per day. The four children work as security guards at Angkor Wat and typically earn $2 per day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a water pump to water the crops as it is difficult in dry season without water. They are requesting a loan $500.

loans.use: This couple hopes to ues this loan to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
The sale and marketing of lamb’s wool and alpaca fiber is one of the most popular activities in the city of Juliaca. Maritza is 24 years old and no stranger to this kind of work. She’s been doing it since she was an adolescent, and little by little she acquired excellent knowledge and results, thanks to the advice and motivation that her parents inculcated in her. She learned this job from her parents who were hard-workers with big aspirations in life, just like Maritza. This enterprising woman buys her merchandise from intermediaries or travels to nearby towns to buy it, and when she acquires enough, she sells it wholesale to a textile factory in Arequipa. Market demand is increasing, and as such, Maritza needs to increase her business capital. That’s why she is asking for a loan.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste.

La comercialización de lana de oveja y fibra de alpaca es una de las actividades más populares en la ciudad de Juliaca. Maritza joven de 24 años de edad no es ajena a esta labor, se dedica a este negocio desde adolescente y poco a poco fue adquiriendo excelentes conocimientos y resultados, gracias a los consejos y motivaciones que sus padres inculcaron en ella.Aprendió esta labor de sus padres quienes siempre demostraron ser personas muy trabajadoras con grandes aspiraciones en la vida al igual que Maritza.Esta emprendedora muchacha adquiere su mercadería de los comerciantes minoristas dedicados a este negocio, y en algunas oportunidades viaja a los diferentes pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad con el fin de reunir una buena cantidad y ser vendido al por mayor a una empresa textil de la ciudad de Arequipa.Al ver la demanda del mercado Maritza tiene pensado aumentar el monto de su capital, con ese propósito recurre a tu persona para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: To increase capital in order to buy bigger quantities of lamb's wool and alpaca fiber.

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima B. is from Lahore, the second largest city in Pakistan. She is married.  Her husband runs a small restaurant where he bakes and sells wheat chapattis. She stays at home and make ice cream sticks. She lives in a family house with her in-laws. Her loan group consists of: Nasreen B. (who will invest in her family’s fruits business), Zubaida B. (who is borrowing for her sugar cane business) and Asiah B. (who sells ready made garments). 
These women have been together for a long time and practice values such as punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to expand her husband's restaurant

loans.name: Tol

texts.en:
Mrs Tol R. (pictured with her mother and her son), 26, and her husband were married in 2001 and have one son and one daughter. Her daughter is in school. Her husband is in full-time employment in Phnom Penh. She lives with her mother along National Road number 6 about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs Tol used to work in a garment factory but now she has stopped working and takes care of her little son who is six months. Beside her husband’s salary, she earns a living from renting her house to garment factory workers because her house is located near the garment factory. Doing so, she earns US$60 per month.

Now she is requesting a loan of US$400 to build more rooms for rent.

loans.use: To build more rooms for rent.

loans.name: Toshbolta

texts.ru:
Toshbolta H. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi. He is married and has 6 children. He is 45 years old and has been working in animal husbandry for 10 years. He has a small farm. Now it has become necessary to build a shed, but he does not have any money for building materials. Therefore, he has decided to take out a loan to make the renovations. It will help to improve conditions and to increase space. Toshbolta will be able to pay off the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Хасанов Тошболта проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Женат и имеет 6 детей. Ему 45 лет и 10 лет он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , но теперь необходимо пристроить сарай, но на стройматериалы денег нет. Поэтому он решил получить кредит и сделать ремонт. Это поможет улучшить условия ухода и увеличить пространство. Погасить кредит Тошболта сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Building a shed

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 16 and 3. His wife works at home, taking care of the children. Bladimir is employed as an external auditor, apart from which he owns a general store and some billiard tables which he rents out. He has 8 years experience in his business and started by selling candies and cleaning supplies. However, through loans he was able to obtain billiard tables to rent.

His plans for his business are to be able to increase the physical size of his business in order for their employees to be more comfortable and more independent of one another. While he is working (as an Auditor) his mother manages the store and the billiard tables. Some of the most demanded products for the store are basic grains and milk products, and with the loan that you grant him he will buy these products and also purchase more cleaning supplies.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Bladimir tiene 34 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 3 años de edad, su esposa se encarga del cuido del hogar y de sus hijos. Bladimir se desempeña como Auditor Externo, pero aparte de eso tiene una pulpería y unas mesas de billares las cuáles alquila. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en este negocio y empezó vendiendo golosinas y productos de limpiezas, pero a través de los créditos a los que pudo acceder logró poner el alquiler de mesas de billar. Los planes para su negocio son poder agrandar el área física de su negocio para poder tener sus negocios más cómodos e independientes uno del otro. Mientras él está trabajando su madre es la encargada de administrar la pulpería y las mesas de billares. Uno de los productos más demandados para la pulpería son los granos básicos y los productos lácteos y con el crédito que le otorguen comprará dichos productos y también comprará productos de limpieza.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, milk products, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Thi Tho

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Tho, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Her husband is a construction worker with the stable monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD). She has 2 children currently studying in college. She started borrowing loans to rear pigs so that her family's income could increase and that she would be able to send her children to school. Her effort is paid off as she is now able to sell the pigs after every 3 months. She wants to purchase breeding pigs so that she will not have to buy piglets to rear every time. This time round, she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD). Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 312.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vương Thị Thơ 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007, chồng chị là công nhân lương tháng ổn định 2.000.000đ, chị sinh được hai con hiện nay hai con chi đang học đai học. Tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập có điều kiện cho các con ăn học. Sự cố gắng của chị và gia đình cũng được đền đáp công việc chăn nuôi rất tôt cứ 3 tháng chị lại xuất 1 lứa lợn. Chị mong muốn tới đây chị sẽ đầu tư vốn mua lợn nái để sinh sản khi chị nuôi lợn thịt không phải mua giống. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000đ. Thu nhập binh quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing Pigs

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia es una amorosa y abnegada madre de 4 hijos, está dedicada al negocio de venta de productos por campaña y al tejido de enaguas, estas actividades, las desempeña  habidamente, con lo que puede apoyar a su esposo  con los gastos de su hogar. Ahora, tiene pensado comprar nueva y variada mercadería y materiales para su confección de enaguas, por lo que solicita este préstamo, Silvia cree  que  con este negocio y el trabajo que realiza su esposo, brindando servicio de movilidad urbana en su triciclo, mejorarán sus ingresos económicos  y la calidad de vida de sus 4 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Silvia is the loving and self-sacrificing mother of four. She works selling seasonal products and weaving traditional Peruvian petticoats. She engages in these activities regularly in order to help her husband with household expenses. Currently, she intends to buy new and varied merchandise as well as materials to make her petticoats; this is why she is seeking a loan. Silvia believes that, with this business and with her husband's work in urban transportation services, they will have more income and will thereby be able to improve their four young children's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise and materials for making petticoats.

loans.name: Mensah

texts.fr: Mensah A. est âgé de 32 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est un acheteur des produits café cacao auprès des cultivateurs et les revend aux exportateurs internationaux. Il exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Etant donné que les fournisseurs exigent des règlements au comptant, Mensah espère par ce crédit satisfaire leurs exigences et tirer profits puisque les ventes seront augmenées conséquence de l’augmentation des achats.
texts.en:
Mensah A. is 32 years old, unmarried, and has no children. He is a buyer of coffee and cocoa products from growers, and he resells them to international exporters. He has been doing this work for three years in Danyi, a village located about 175 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Given that the suppliers are demanding payment in cash, Mensah hopes to use this loan to meet their demands and to derive a profit, since sales will increase due to the increase in purchases.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of coffee and cocoa for resale

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Doris Elizabeth de 30 años de edad, es la presidenta del  Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Desamparados 718 del balneario Buenos Aires Norte del distrito de Víctor Larco  provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudio Enfermería Técnica y primer ciclo de Ingeniería Industrial, pero se casó y por falta de comprensión se separó de su pareja, entonces tuvo que empezar a trabajar para poder mantener a sus pequeños hijos,  que son tres.
Su negocio consiste en una bodega donde mayormente vende golosinas y otros insumos, también tiene un locutorio, pero aun no cuenta con cabinas. Se ubica en su casa.
Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles que devolvió en 4 cuotas compró arroz, azúcar y papel higiénico.
Con este crédito de 800 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará insumos y algunos utensilios  para elaborar postres, también venderá ropa interior, manifiesta que para ello compró una vitrina grande.
Doris, sueña con tener su propia movilidad.
texts.en:
Doris Elizabeth is 30 years old, president of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” and she lives at Desamparados Street 718, Buenos Aires Norte neighborhood, Victor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She student technical nursing and the first year of industrial engineering, but she married and because of lack of understanding between she and her husband, they separated. She then had to begin to work in order to support her three small children. Her business consists of a convenience store where she sells candy and other consumable products, she also has a telephone café, but she doesn’t have private phone cabins yet. Her business is located in her home. With the first loan for 300 soles which was repaid in 4 payments she bought rice, sugar and toilet paper. With this loan for 800 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy consumables and some utensils to make desserts, also she will sell underwear, for which she has purchased a display case. Doris dreams of having her own means of transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy consumables and utensils to sell

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mr. Chek M. is a villager in Neil village in Takeo Province. He is an ice cream seller in the local village. Because his business is going well, he wants to expand it; thus, he decided to ask for a loan to combine with his savings to buy a motorbike to transport his ice cream and sell door-to-door. He hopes to increase his income and provide a better life for his family. His wife, Mrs. Eam Vy, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Chek M. is 26 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study because they are one and four years old. His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To combine with his savings and buy a motorbike to transport his ice cream and sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Daysi Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Daysi Yesenia, socia del BC “Los Jazmines”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general y bebidas gasificadas. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa, lugar donde acuden a diario sus clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual pagará en 06 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, detergentes de diferentes marcas, conservas, leche en cajas, artículos de higiene personal y demás productos que requiere para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.

Daysi Yesenia tiene 29 años de edad, vive con sus 02 hijos y su esposo quien se dedica a trabajos eventuales. Está agradecida por el apoyo brindado que le permite crecer en su negocio, Su meta es crecer en su negocio y comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Daysi Yesenia is a member of the Community Bank “Los Jazmines” (The Jazmines). She lives in the San Martín region, province and district of Moyabamba. She own a grocery store where she sells food and sodas. She has the store at home, where she receives customers every day. She will use this $1000 loan, which will be paid back in 6 months, to purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, detergent, durable products, milk, hygiene items and others to diversify her business and to satisfy her customer’s needs. Daysi Yesenia is 29 years old. She lives with her 2 children and her husband who has a temporary job. She is very grateful with all the support she has received that has helped improve her business and to also purchase a new house.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic products such as rice, sugar, detergent, durable products, milk, hygiene items and others

loans.name: Atardecer Group

texts.es: El grupo "Atardecer" Esta representado por la señora Martha y conformado por 15 miembros los cuales se conocen D. varios años ya que residen en el mismo barrio. En general los socios se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como zapatos, plantas , cuero, materiales eléctricos, venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y ropa, algunos se dedican al la fabricación artesanías y al servicio D. abogacía. Los socios D. este grupo tienen bastante experiencia en sus rubros por lo que no les asusta la competencia en el mercado. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. materiales e insumos para su actividad comercial y a la mejora del las herramientas D. trabajo para mejorar la calidad D. sus productos. Es el primer financiamiento que los socios (as) obtienen como grupo solidario pero confían en sus compañeros (as) y se sienten capaces D. cumplir con la fundación Agrocapital que les brinda una oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad D. vida así como la des su familias.
texts.en:
The group “Atardecer” is represented by Señora Martha and is maD. up of 15 members who have known each other for a number of years and live in the same neighbourhood. In general, the members sell various products such as shoes, plants, leather, electrical good, groceries at neighbourhood stalls and clothes. Some make handicrafts and others proviD. legal services.

The members of the group have quite a lot of experience in their professions and titles and as such the competition in the market doesn’t scare them.This loan is destined for the purchase of materials and supplies for their commercial activities and the improvement of their professional tools in order to better the quality of their products.

This is the first loan that the members are requesting as a group but they trust their partners and feel they are able to fulfill the terms of their loan with Fundación Agrocapital, who offers them the opportunity to increase their revenue and improve their quality of life, along with that of their families.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Jerlyn B. is a mother of 4 children. She is a farmer, and rice is her main crop. Her husband, Carlito, is the one who manages their small farm. Because of hard work, they were able to send their children to school near their village. Jerlyn started her rice farm business using her 4 hectares of land. In her experience as a farmer, her farm produces an average of 418 sacks per harvest. From her harvest, she has enough food for the family and is able to sell more rice in the village and to some of the rice traders.

She is asking a loan of Php 11,000 from CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner). Her loan will be used to buy fertilizers and herbicides. She believes that her loan will bring her more harvest. For her, fertilizers will definitely increase her yield. Aside from farming, she also considers looking for some other possible income areas to help her address the needs of her family.

CEVI helps Jerlyn grow her farm. Now she enjoys availing herself the credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage CEVI gives to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and molluscides

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar C. lives with his wife, a daughter and a son in Tsetserleg, a city in Arkhangay province. His son works in the capital city, Ulaanbaatar, and the daughter is a college student. His wife helps to run his business. He has years of experience in making wooden products. In 2000, he started his business with revenue of 100,000 tugrig ($1 USD=1,500 tugrig). Currently, the revenue has increased to 2,000,000 tugrig. His business has already been well established in the market and has many individual and corporate customers. He is very skillful and his shop is well equipped. He focuses mostly on product quality. His loan history is very good. He would like to use this loan to purchase equipment and some raw materials. Ganbaatar is well respected locally for his business and for his hard work. In the future, he hopes to train apprentices in carpentry and to continue to provide good-quality wooden products for the city. He also hopes to have a larger place for his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment, wood and other raw materials for his business.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en: Mrs. Tha N. lives in Sophy village in Takeo province. She breeds pigs and chickens. Since her pig breeding  business is doing well, she wants to expand it by buying more piglets and pig meal, and expand the piggery. She also needs the money to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Khem May, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a   palm juice collector. Mrs. Tha N. is 39 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom work in a garment factory while the third  attends the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy piglets and  pig meal, expand the piggery, and to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Comunidad Unida - Group 3

texts.en:
Juana R. is the group representative of these five entrepreneurs. Their group is part of a larger Bank of Hope that has 45 members in total (including them). Juana has requested a second loan, after successfully paying her first loan with Esperanza International, Kiva's partner. She has two small businesses: she sells clothing (which she started with her first loan) and has a candy stand (which she will expand with this loan; she started it with profits from her clothing sales).

Juana explains that the reason for having two businesses is to balance her sales. Although clothing sales are less frequent, the profits are larger. However, in the candy stand, she sells every day, which gives her good pocket money. She finds that after her first loan, her business is doing better. This was the main reason she took the second loan: to expand her sales capacity. She would like to take her two businesses to a larger scale: set up a clothing store and be a candy distributor in her area.

Juana obviously dreams big—she says dreams keep the businesswoman alive. Please help us to continue supporting her endeavors, along with her group mates. Thank you.

loans.use: buy pants, blouses and sandals for clothing business; buy lollipops, gum and caramels for small candy stand (side business)

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says all of her children are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a cocoa farmer.

Akosua is a businesswoman. She runs a provisions store on one of the principal streets in her community. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Akosua has been in business for over eight years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Nabila Faqeer Hussain Group

texts.en:
Voilet baji and Sharifan baji each want a loan to buy wood for their furniture-making business. 
Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 

Nabila baji is the group leader of these three ladies. She is married to F. H. who drives a horse cart. He uses this cart as a public transport and charges different fares area wise. Her group is very responsible; they manage their own businesses to pay off the utilities and to give ease to their husbands. Nabila baji is also applying for a loan to buy a new horse cart, because the old one became rotted and rough from different areas.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a new horse cart

loans.name: Alicia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo e interés por desarrollar su negocio, la señora Alicia O. se dedica a la comercialización de ropa en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega siendo este negocio el que le permite percibir ingresos para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día ella necesita invertir en la compra de la ropa para comercializarla y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito y así adquirir la mercadería y ofrecerla a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Having a lot of enthusiasm and desire to develop her business, Alicia O. sells clothing in Chinandega's Central Market. This business allows her to earn money for her development. Currently she needs to invest in buying clothes to sell, which is why she turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan, which will enable her to acquire merchandise that she can offer to her loyal clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señora Zoila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Flor Azangarina II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Azangaro, Provincia de Azangaro, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo.  Ella tiene estudios de secundaria incompleta (2do grado),  vive en el Barrio VilcA..

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  el cual utilizó para la compra de prendas de vestir (ropas). 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de medias, buzos, chompitas, etc y también comprará ropa para adultos en todas las tallas como pantalones, blusas, buzos, medias, etc.

Su mayor sueño es poder implementar un taller metal mecánica para así poder trabajar con su hijo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y los pagos puntuales.
texts.en:
Zoila belongs to the Flor Azangarina II Community Bank in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 41, and she is the single mother of one son. She completed her second year of high school. She lives in the VilcA. neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy clothes. She now needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy socks, track suits, and sweaters, etc. She will also buy all sizes of adult clothing like pants, blouses, track suits, and socks, etc. Her biggest dream is to be able to set up a metal works shop to be able to work with her son. She likes the savings and the punctual payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy socks, track suits, sweaters, pants, and blouses, etc.

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es: Fabiola del Socorro tiene la edad de 36 años, casada y reside en el barrio la Esperanza en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos, los tres estudian,  su esposo  trabaja en la policía de jefe de sector. Su anhelo es poder terminar de construir su casa., su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, y la venta de cosméticos, inicio desde muy joven a vender, tiene veinte tres años de experiencia en las venta pues anteriormente vendía  con su mama. Con este crédito quiere comprar, ropa, zapatos en variedad para ofertar a sus clientes, con esto espera mejorar sus ganancias y poder sastifacer sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Fabiola del Socorro is 36 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood of La Esperanza in the capital city of Managua. She has three children, all of whom are students. Her husband is the division police chief.

Her goal is to finish construction of her house. She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She began her business at a very young age -- she has 23 years of experience. Previously, she sold products for her mother’s business. With this loan, she will buy a variety of clothes and shoes to offer to her customers. She hopes to increase her earnings and satisfy her basic necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Mr. T. Sary, 27 and his wife, Mrs. Aminas Mat, 24, have been married since 2007 and just have a little daughter. They live along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

T. and his wife sell cosmetics (perfume, powder, lipsticks), radios… etc. They buy their goods from Phnom market and transport them to sell in other districts, faraway from their house. His motorbike is old and breaks down, so T. is asking for his first loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike to replace the old one and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: Rosalía tiene 51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 22 años se dedica a L. crianza D. ganado porcino y ovino y al cultivo D. papa. Todos los días trabaja alimentando a sus animales y limpiando sus establos para mantenerlos saludables. Asimismo, periódicamente revisa sus extensiones D. terreno y observa que sus plantaciones estén libres D. plagas. Durantes todos estos años su experiencia le ha permitido prevenir las enfermedades D. sus animales y D. sus plantas, para así mejorar su producción. D. esta forma sus ventas en los mercados D. L. ciudad y las ferias ganaderas son más satisfactorias. El trabajo que realiza lo hace junto a su familia y eso L. hace sentir muy contenta. Esta es L. cuarta oportunidad que tiene para un crédito con MFP, elL. es una socia muy comprometida con su banco comunal y nuevamente renueva su compromiso con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando le servirá para L. compra D. sacos D. abono y ganado ovino.
texts.en:
Rosalía is 51 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. Since she was 22 years old, she has spent her time raising pigs and sheep as well as growing potatoes. Every day she feeds her animals and cleans the stables in order to keep them healthy. At the same time, she oversees her tracts of land to determine that her crops are free of pests. Over the years, her experience has enabled her to prevent disease in her animals and crops and improve her production. Rosalía happens to find selling her products in the city markets and at livestock fairs more satisfying. She is the happiest in knowing that she gets to work alongsiD. her family.

Rosalía is taking her 4th loan with MFP. She is a very committed member of her Communal Bank and has renewed her commitment to the group. The money she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of fertilizer and heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizer & heads of sheep

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Mrs. Nimol O., 26, and her husband, Mr. Chenda So, 24, were married in 2007 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The family lives on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Nimol is a tailor. Besides her tailoring business, she is a silk weaver as well. Her husband has been a mason for four years. He works in Phnom Penh. Nimol hopes to create another new business selling rice wine; it will better for her to earn extra income to support her family. Thus, she is requesting her first loan of US$200 to purchase rice wine for resale.

loans.use: To purchase rice wine for resale.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 47 years old and she manages a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village.  She wants her business to expand and earn bigger income in order to support the daily needs of her family.  Her weekly business income from her store is around PHP 2,000, which she uses as rolling capital for her business and as daily school allowance for her children.  She would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase some grocery items to retail in her store. She believes that through the support of the lenders, her business will be on the right track as she continues to persevere towards the success of her business.  

She is married to Domingo, a farmer, and they have two children.  Their eldest is a college student and their youngest is now a senior high school student. They are residing at Barangay Namnama Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural and plain area where farming is the major source of income for most of the residents.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en: Chhen R., 42, is a wedding chef who lives in the Siem Reap province with her husband and four of her children. She typically makes about US$2 each day, while her husband is a farmer who typically makes about US$1 each day and is supported by their son working as a mechanic. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. Chhen R. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for family transportation. (Chhen and her husband were not available so their son is pictured instead)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Asumpata

texts.en:
Asumpata M. currently sells cold drinks like water, soda, juice, etc. at a shop. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more two refrigerators for keeping the soft drinks cold. Asumpata is 45 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 6 children, all of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a drugstore.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, all of which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchasing two more refrigerators

loans.name: Celita

texts.en:
Celita S. is from the village of  Kiburiao,  in Quezon Bukidnon. She is 41 years old. Celita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Celita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Celita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Celita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.
