Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet N. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Janet has a secretarial services business, which she has run for two years. She is also a salary earner.
To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase computers for her secretarial business. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Janet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to open a training center offering computer lessons.

loans.use: To purchase computers for her secretarial business

loans.name: Pech's Group

texts.en:
Twelve people have formed a village bank loan.   They are located in Roung Kou village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. P. K. was born in 1966 and is the village bank leader. She was selected to be the leader by the other members. She is a widow with five children.  Three are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is Khmer cake seller, and the last one is a student in the local school. She earns her living by selling meatballs and sugar cane. With her business, she is able to earn a small income to support her family.  Currently, her family living doesn’t have water at their home. So P. K. is asking for a loan to dig a well.

loans.use: To dig a well.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Besetana Betty lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. Betty has been a farmer for 3 years, working 7 days out of every week. Betty sells her products at the market both wholesale and retail. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of millet and mushroom mother spawn. She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenge(s) for Betty include drought, which hits most parts of Uganda and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and to start exporting mushrooms to neighboring countries. Betty lives in a home that she owns with access to electricity and access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet and mushroom mother spawn

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 36 years old and married with three children who are in school.  Melda works very hard to provide for them.

Melda runs a rice retail/general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Melda has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as rice, wine, sardines, noodles, shampoo, soap etc. 

In the future, Melda would like to expand her business and own a house and lot.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Upendo Kahembe Group

texts.fr: Zamuda M. est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe d’affaire « Upendo Kahembe »,  âgée de 53 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants dont 3 fréquentent l’école et 4 ont leur propres foyers. Son mari fut décédé il y a longtemps. La cliente Zamuda M. est vendeuse des habits (boubous femmes et habits de juniors). Elle expose ses produits dans un magasin, à son domicile et parfois auprès  des preneurs fonctionnaire souvent agents des entreprises publiques. Elle vient de réaliser 4 ans opérationnels en bénéficiant de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouvelles marchandises au niveau de Tanzanie (50 boubous, 50 complets juniors,  30 boubous hommes, pantalons jeans, Loïs, et l'autre somme d’argent servira pour le frais douanier, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise, construire confortablement une maison, acheter une voiture jeep pour son déplacement.  La cliente Zamuda M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres veuves exclus de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Upendo kahembe » est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en: Zamuda M. is an entrepreneur and president of the « Upendo Kahembe » business group.  She is a 53-year-old widow and mother of seven, three of whom are still in school and four of whom run their own households. Her husband passed away a long time ago.  Zamuda M. sells clothing (womens’ boubous and childrens’ clothing).  She sells her products in a store, from her home and sometimes to customers who are government employees, particularly officials from public corporations.  She has just celebrated her four-year anniversary of being in operation, supported by a loan from the MFI Hekima.  This new loan will help her increase her inventory with new merchandise from Tanzania (50 boubous, 50 childrens’ outfits, 30 mens’ boubous, jeans, including Loïs brand jeans, and the remaining funds will help her cover customs charges, etc.).  She also hopes to expand her business, to be able to afford to build a house and to buy a jeep for greater mobility.  Zamuda M. would like to thank Hekima for its work on behalf of widows living in poverty without access to conventional banks.  It’s worth mentioning that the “Upendo Kahembe” group is majority female.

loans.use: 50 boubous, 50 childrens' outfits, 30 mens' boubous, jeans, and Loïs brand jeans, with the remaining funds going to cover customs charges, etc.

loans.name: Siyaphambili Group

texts.en:
Sithembile M. is the leader of the Siyaphambile group. She is 50 years old , married and has three children, aged 26, 23 and 17. One of the children is attending school. 

She is a cross-border trader who sells doilies, seat covers, African attire and bedspreads out of Zimbabwe but within the southern Africa region. She has been operating this business for the past nine years. She also gets extra income for the family from her farming activities and from her husband, who is a driver in Botswana.

Sithembile has requested this loan through MicroKing to purchase raw material (poly cotton, Java fabric, satin fabric, foam rubber, sheeting and mendy material) to make seat covers, bedspreads and African attire. 

Her only challenges are the limits on goods to export and import and also hassles she goes through on crossing the border. However, she sees the extra income from this loan increasing her disposable income and improving her family's health and general upkeep. 

She envisions herself owning a boutique and employing people. 

Sithembile is thankful of the support being given to women.
 
Note: In the picture Sithembile is sitting.

loans.use: To purchase raw material (poly cotton, Java fabric, satin fabric, foam rubber, sheeting and mendy material) to make seat covers, bedspreads and African attire.

loans.name: Rosalbina

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosalbina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas II”, Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es soltera, tiene  46  años  y es madre de 04  hijos,  una  mujer  y tres varones. Tres  de ellos cursan estudios superiores  y una  secundaria.

Con seguridad y gran entrega decide desde muy pequeña  iniciarse   en la venta  de abarrotes, actividad que le impedía dedicar más tiempo a sus hijos siendo aun estos pequeños por lo que decide cambiar por la venta de refrigerios siendo  su capital de inicio fue de S/ 100.00  nuevos soles, actualmente la atención a su clientela lo comparte con sus hijos,  quienes asisten diariamente a consumir los productos que ofrece preparados con muy buena sazón.   

Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como maíz choclo, mote, aceite, carne de pollo y de cerdo, huevos, aceitunas, sal y especies que utiliza en la preparación de tamales y humitas que prepara diariamente para su venta.    Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de  verduras y frutas de la región para la preparación de ensaladas, jugos y refrescos para acompañar el refrigerio. 

Rosalbina,  siempre está contenta y con ganas de seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos y su familia  hasta convertir su  hogar en un gran restaurant  para poder vender comida tipo menú  a diario. Está Agradecida con el  Movimiento Manuela Ramos por la ayuda que le brinda al  contribuir  con el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en:
Rosalbina is a member of the ‘Las Margaritas II’ Communal Bank located in the District of La Banda de Shilcayo within the Province and Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, single, and is the mother of four children – one daughter and three sons. Three of her children are completing post-secondary studies and one is in high school.

With confidence and great dedication, she decided to start selling groceries at a young age, a job that prevented her from spending more time with her children when they were young. As a result, she decided to change to selling refreshments, starting with 100 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) in capital. She currently works with her children tending to her customers who come to eat her good flavored products on a daily basis.

With this loan of 1,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN), she will buy supplies such as corn, boiled wheat, oil, chicken and pork, eggs, olives, salt and spices that she uses to make tamales and humitas (a dish similar to the tamale) to sell on a daily basis. She will also invest part of the loan in the purchase of regional vegetables and fruits to make salads, juices and refreshments to accompany the food.

Rosalbina is always happy and wants to continue working in order to get her children and family ahead in life. She wants to make her home into a large restaurant in order to be able to sell a daily set menu. She is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the support provided to help her fulfill her dream.

loans.use: buy supplies such as corn, boiled wheat, oil, chicken and pork, eggs, olives, salt and spices, as well as regional vegetables and fruit.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es: El señor Ramón y su esposa Guillermina están solicitando nuestra cooperación  para realizarle una mejora a su casa, debido a que ellos no cuentan con el dinero necesario para hacerla. Esta mejora   consiste en poner piso de concreto en el pasillo lateral de afuera de  la casa ya que en temporada de lluvias dicho pasillo se vuelve un problema para los integrantes de la familia, debido a que se hace lodo y esto ocasiona que no se pueda pasar por ahí y se vuelve insano para los habitantes de la casa. Debido a esto el señor ramón solicita este préstamo y se compromete a pagarlo de forma puntual, y lo pagara con sus ingresos como operario. Ya que este brindara una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, así como también  mejoraran  el patrimonio que ellos desean brindarles a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ramón and his wife Guillermina are asking for our cooperation to do some home improvements because they lack the necessary funds to do it.  This improvement consists in laying a concrete floor in the outside lateral passageway because during the rainy season this passageway becomes a problem for the family members because it becomes mud and it become impossible to go through there because it becomes unhealthy for the residents of the house.  

Because of this, Ramón is asking for this loan and he commits to repay it on time using the wages he earns as a worker.  This will provide a better quality of life for his family as well as improve the patrimony they’d like to leave their children.

loans.use: to lay a concrete floor.

loans.name: Hiền's Group

texts.en:
Hiền, 41, is married and has two school-aged children. She lives in the town of Yen Phong district, Băc Ninh province. Hiền is the leader of a three-member group, Đông Mai 2 (2.1), that is obtaining a loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

To making a living, Hiền is a woodworker, manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Hiền has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month.

In 2009, Hiền joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She has successfully repaid a loan of 6,944,000 VND from SEDA (this loan will be the third taken out by Hiền from SEDA). This previous loan was used to purchase wood and other materials. She is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND, which will be used to purchase more materials to expand her product offerings to such items as tables and chairs.

Hiền plans to use her additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. Loan is a 27-year-old woman who is requesting a 8,288,000 VND loan to support her business making furniture such as tables and chairs . 2. Phố is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,840,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to expand her product offerings to such items as tables and chairs.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, 44, is the married father of two children. 

Robert has been a hair dresser since 1987. He is well known in his region for his good reputation and the customer care he provides. Most of his clients are neighbors, relatives and friends, in addition to others who hear of him from his loyal customers.

Robert has been an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner borrower for two cycles. His previous loan had a very good impact on his social and financial situation. That's why he's requesting another loan this time. This loan will be used to pay for his children school expenses. He can't pay them from his business because urgent issues come up suddenly and he has to cover them.
 
Robert is a good-standing borrower and a hard worker. He hopes to expand his business by offering beauty care, a spa and other requested services.

loans.use: To pay for his children school expenses.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Doña Victoria D. 32 años, casada con tres hijos uno D. ellos ya estudia, su esposo trabaja como chofer  D. rutas cortas en transportes colectivos, desD. hace 7 años, doña Victoria inicio con su negocio desD. hace  tres años con venta D. ropa tipica, ella venD. cortes, blusas, güipiles, u otros. Al contado y por abonos, venD. todos los días solo por la tarD., también venD. tamales los fines D. semana el sábado por la tarD. y los domingos por la mañana.ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra D. ropa tipica por mayor y aprovechar las ferias para vender, está feliz porque pueD. ayudar a su esposo económicamente y darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Victoria, 32, is married with 3 children, one of whom is in school. Her husband has worked as a collective transport driver on short routes for 7 years. Victoria started her business 3 years ago. She sells traditional clothing like skirts, blouses, güipiles [traditional woven blouses] and other things. She sells in cash and on installment plans and works every afternoon. She also sells tamales on the weekends - Saturday afternoons and Sunday mornings. 

She is asking for this loan to buy typical clothing in bulk and take advantage of the markets to sell them. She is happy because she can help her husband out economically and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Mary Louvi

texts.en:
Mary Louvi is 36, married, and has two children aged three and two. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for some time now. Her husband is the one who mainly manages their rice farm. She makes sure to support him in keeping their rice farm productive. 

Mary Louvi also manages their sari-sari (variety) store business. The store has been running for two years now. Mary Louvi sells items like sugar, vinegar, and cooking oil. 

Mary Louvi requested a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She is hopeful that this loan will help them achieve a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Don Esteban es comerciante de una pulperia que administra junto   a su esposa, su negocio tiene once años en las ventas, pues de profesion es mecanico pero debido a su condicion de su pies, que tuvo un accidente, lo ejerce poco. Y que con esos otros ingresos se ayuda para pagar gastos basicos.
Don Esteban ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivivenda en donde ha hecho el muro, que es de gran relevancia para su seguridad, hoy en dia hara cambio de techo y el piso del bajarete, los materiales a comprar bloques, arena, cemento, y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Esteban is storekeeper of a grocery store that he runs with his wife.  Their business has been open for 11 years.  Though by profession he is a mechanic, he does not practice much because he injured his feet in an accident.  With this other income he is able to pay his basic expenses.

Esteban has been improving the infrastructure of his home, where he has built a wall that is very important for his safety.  Currently, he will work on putting in a new roof and floor for the shed.  He needs to buy blocks, sand, and cement to begin building.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof and put a floor in the shed, improving the condition of his home

loans.name: Fifana Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FIFANA est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pascaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pascaline est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Martial. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pascaline mène comme activité depuis quinze ans la vente de boissons. A côté de cette activité qui lui génère des revenus non négligeables, Pascaline vend  des articles de merceries dans son atelier. Pascaline s’approvisionne  dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pascaline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FIFANA, un troisième crédit. Ce crédit leur servira à augmenter leurs stocks de produits.
texts.en:
The group FIFANA is composed of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé in order to boost their businesses. The group's representative, by the name of Pascaline, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and married to a welder by the name of Martial. They have three children, who are all in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Pascaline has been running a business selling beverages for fifteen years. Aside from this business, which generates significant income for her, she sells sewing supplies in her workshop. She is supplied from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and wanting to increase her sales and her revenues, Pascaline and the other members of the group FIFANA are requesting a third loan. This loan will serve to increase their inventory of products.

loans.use: to buy beverages and sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a poultry unit and buy more birds

loans.name: Tai

texts.en:
Tai is a 43-year-old married man. He lives with three children and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife is a merchant. 

Tai earns an income to support his family by selling gas tanks to people in his community. He has done this for the past 11 years. He intends to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of gas tanks from different suppliers to better meet his customers' needs.

He hopes that his business will go well and provide him with enough income to stabilize his living conditions and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy gas tanks to sell

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución, tiene 55 años, es socia del FINCA Peru desde hace 5 años.
Aquilina, trabaja en la chacra en Compañía, ahora sembró alfalfa y vainita, recuerda que el primer crédito lo utilizó para poder comprar semillas e insecticidas, ahora las lluvias que hubo dañaron su chacra, de nuevo esta resurgiendo, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a poder mejorar su negocio y como administrarlo, este préstamo lo invertirá, en la compra de semillas y abono para su siembra, la meta que tiene es poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the "Solución" ("Solution") communal bank.  She is 55 years old, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for the last five years.

Aquilina works on a farm in Compañía, she is currently growing alfafa and string beans.  She recalls that her first loan was used to buy seeds and insecticides.  Now that the rains have damaged her farm, she is starting up again.  

She loves the trainings because they help her to improve her business and teach her how to manage it.

This loan will be invested in buying seeds and manure for her planting.  Her goal is to be able to build a home for herself.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for her planting.

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is 44 years old and not married. She supports a family of five people.She has applied for a loan  of Kshs.25000 which she will use to buy stock of clothes for sale.

Maryline has been running her boutique shop for a period of three years.She earns an income of Kshs.13000 per month. The anticipated profit she will use to buy  more stock for her business.

This is Maryline's fourth loan from KADET LTD. Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to build rental houses and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 47 años, casado con Adriana de 45 años, y fruto de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos habitan en el distrito de Sivia, donde tienen su casa propia. Víctor, es una persona que se caracteriza por tener muchos proyectos, una de ellas es la de cultivar plantas de cacao, actividad que lo realiza en compañía de su esposa. A medida que éste negocio se consolidaba, incursionó luegio en producir cacao injertados que se cosechan en menor tiempo y dando un rendimiento óptimo. Pero él planea cultivar otros productos, por ello se levanta muy temprano para preparar la tierras que aún falta por sembrar. Generalmente recibe la ayuda de su familia al momento que necesite extraer sus productos, como el cacao, ya que éste producto tiene mucho mayor demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, en especial el cacao orgánico que Victor sabe cultivar, pues recibe buena paga por cada kilo de aquel fruto. En un futuro próximo él desea implementar su vivero para injertar cacao. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1.500 soles, comprará más plantas de cacao para sembrarlas en su parcela.
texts.en:
Víctor is 47 years old and married to 45-year-old Adriana.  The couple have four children and live together in Sivia district, where they have their own house.

Víctor is a man of many projects.  One of these projects is growing cacao plants, an activity that he carries out together with his wife.  As this business was becoming established, he started producing grafted cacao plants which can be harvested in less time and provide an optimal yield.  However, he also plans to grow other crops.  He gets up very early to prepare the land that still has nothing growing in it.  Generally, he has the help of his family when he needs to pick his cacao, for which there is great demand both at home and abroad, particularly for organic cacao which Víctor knows how to grow and for which he receives a good price per kilo.  In the near future, Víctor would like to stock his [plant] nursery for grafting cacao.

This will be Víctor's first loan from MFP and he pledges to make his repayments on time.  He will use his 1,500 soles to buy more cacao plants to sow on his land.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Afiwavi

texts.fr:
Afiwavi est une femme âgée de 23 ans. Elle est célibataire et sans enfants. 
Afiwavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Afiwavi  vend des savons  à Akodessewa(un quartier de la place) Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule.
Afiwavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter une variété de savons. 
Dans les prochaines années, Afiwavi voudrait agrandir son stock de savons.
texts.en:
Afiwavi is a 23-year-old woman.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  

Afiwavi has been working as a retailer since 2009.  She sells soap in Akodessewaune (in a local neighborhood).  She buys her products in Lomé and works alone.

Afiwavi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy a variety of soaps.

Over the coming years, Afiwavi would like to expand her stock of soaps.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Jerome provides a motorcycle transport service and has been in business for five years.  He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and to pay for gasoline and motorcycle maintenance.

Jerome has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jerome hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and to pay for gasoline and motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.

Angelina has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms, dresses, and curtains. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Vaaipu

texts.en: Vaaipu is 42 years old and lives in the town of Saasaai with her husband and four school-aged children. For the last two years, she has earned a living by growing crops, particularly taro. She earns about 1,600 WST a month. In 2008, Vaaipu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from SPBD and is applying for a new one, for 2,500 WST .to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.  She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman who has one child. Leonila is 32 years old and resides in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Leonila operates a business providing transportation services to local community members, and she's been in this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 8,000 pesos doing this type of work. 

She requested a loan of 25,000 pesos to purchase additional vehicle spare parts. Leonila has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Leonila wants to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 39 years old and chose to be single. She commits herself to caring for her beloved parents and to supporting her younger sisters. They live happily in a village, planting and harvesting rice and onions for sale. Since it is the major source of their income, she plans to expand their onion production to ensure a high yield.

Despite the hardships in farming, she has the strong determination to improve their onion farming business. She is requesting for a loan of P20,000 to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed for onion production. She mentioned that through this loan, she will work out her plan and hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds, fertilizers and pesticides needed  for onion production

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 36 years old, single with one one child. She sells used clothes to earn a living, she has been in the business for 8 years and has employed one person. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able expand her business. She hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy skirts,trousers and sweaters.

loans.use: To buy skirts, trousers and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Aura Estela

texts.es: Doña Aura es una mujer laboriosa de 46 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas desde hace cuatro años, cuenta con el apoyo de su hija quien le ayuda a vender, una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio, por lo que solicita por primera vez financiamiento en la institución para la compra de aretes, anillos, cadenas y pulseras.

loans.use: para la compra de aretes, anillos, cadenas y pulseras.

loans.name: Fazila

texts.en:
Fazila is 19 years old girl living in district 5 in Kabul, Afghanistan.

She is single and continuing her studies, but she took loan for her brother to help grow his business. She believes that AFSG gives him more loan cycles to increase her brother's business.

loans.use: Buying goods and fresh vegitable.

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Mario and his wife Mrs. Violeta Rodriguez have been in the cakes and jellied sweets business for 5 years. "We'd like to purchase more ingredients to be able to make new products given the fact that we know how to prepare a wide variety of cakes and sweets, but we cannot afford the ingredients to make them. We are requesting $1,000 to purchase the necessary ingredients for our business."

Translated form Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Mario y su esposa la Sra. Violeta Rodriguez llevan ya 5 años en el negocio de la venta de Pasteles y Gelatinas “Queremos comprar mas ingredientes para la elaboración de nuevos productos ya que sabemos preparar muchos pasteles y gelatinas diferentes pero no hemos podido comprar lo necesario para hacerlos" Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar lo necesario para mi negocio.

loans.use:
Purchase of additional supplies to make more desserts and pastries.

Comprar mas ingredientes para la elaboración de los postres

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom is engaged in business for over 5 years. She is mother of 3 children. Her trade place located at the 3 floor of the crowded central market at Badri Munir. She is an enthusiastic and lively entrepreneur, selling women’s clothes. She has a lot of clients. She always has a variety of beautiful goods Her goods are high quality and meet the demand for modern clothes. She brings her goods from Bishkek, Kirgisistan. Her monthly income comes to around $800.
She would like to increase her turnover of goods and requests additional $1200 for her next purchase from the wholesale market.

loans.use: Purchase modern clothes

loans.name: Bimarziya

texts.ru:
Bimarziya K. has a cattle farm at home. She is married and has 6 children. Bimarziya’s husband is retired; her children are all grown up and have their own families. For a few years now, with the help of her husband, Bimarziya raises and resells cattle. In 2005, when Bimarziya joined MicroInvest lending program, her business assets were worth $1200. After receiving the loan and through targeted investment, Bimarziya increased her business assets up to $2000. She used the money to purchase more cattle. In the future, Bimarziya plans to further increase the number of animals and improve the feeding area of the farm.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Калонова Бимарзия - занимается скотоводством дома. Замужем, имеет шестеро детей. Муж пенсионер, дети взрослые и каждый имеет свою семью. Вот уже несколько лет она занимается откормом и купля продажей крупнорогатого скота. В этой деятельности помогает ей, её муж. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в 2005 году, тогда у нее активы были на 1200$. После получения займа и целевого использования, её активы возросли до 2000$. Она приобрела крупнорогатый скот. В будущем планирует увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить место для откорма.

loans.use: To increase the number of animals and improve the feeding area of the farm

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala (her husband is  pictured) is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She and her husband have been in the fruit-selling business for a year, selling watermelons in the local market. They plan to improve their business by purchasing more agricultural produce and fruit, for which they need a loan of $725.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce and fruits

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Sra. Zenaida is a founding member of the Manuela Ramos de Tinco community bank. She earns a living raising and selling small animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, ducks, geese and pigs). Her stall is located in the Carhuaz district market in northern Peru.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$330), to be repaid in 6 installments, Sra. Zenaida has purchased feed, vaccines and other supplies to better care for her animals and sell them for a good price.

Sra. Zenaida, 43, is married and has 2 children. With the earnings from her business, she sends her children to school and propels her family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Ella es la señora Zenaida, es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal Manuela Ramos de Tinco, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores (cuyes, conejos, gallinas, patos, pavos y chanchos”, su lugar de venta es en el mercado del Distrito de Carhuaz y en las ferias del Distrito de Yungay, de la región Ancash.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,000.00 soles ($ 330) que pagara en 6 cuotas, ha comprado, granos, vacunas, afrecho de cebada para alimentar mejor a sus animales y poder venderlos a buen precio.

La señora tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los ingresos de su negocio educa a sus hijos y saca adelante a su hogar.

loans.use: Buy feed and vaccines for animal farming business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria E. lives in her mother’s house with her three daughters, in the San Simon zone on the north side of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Maria E. works at a mobile phone center in the Villa Fatima zone. This job provides income for her family.

Her home has an area in the front of it which could be used to open a neighborhood store. This would increase her family income.

The requested loan is for the construction of a stand alone, brick room for the store.

This is the first time that she applies for a loan. The favorable review of her socioeconomic status qualifies her to be granted credit.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Maria E. vive en casa de su madre en la zona de San Simón ladera norte de la Ciudad de La Paz con sus tres hijas. La señora Maria E. atiende un centro de telefonía móvil en la zona de Villa Fatima, ocupación que le permite ingresos a su familia.

Su vivienda tiene un espacio en el frente que le brindad la posibilidad de instalar una tienda de barrio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de una habitación (tienda) independiente de ladrillo.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construction of a room for a store

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 39 years old and married. She financially supports her 59-year-old mother and earns money selling clothing and snacks. Zainab started this business in 1989. Every day, she works from 7 am to 4 pm and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$110.

Zainab would like to take out a loan to buy more items for sale. She is a member of the loan group Tuimarike which has a total of 33 members who help each other in paying back their loans.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for sale

loans.name: Chhung

texts.en: Mrs. Chung R. is a mother of one school-aged child.  She works at the Mithy Khorn massage parlor, making $3 each day. Her husband is a tuk-tuk driver and earns about $5 per day. Mrs. Chung R. requests a loan to buy a motor-bike to commute to work.  The rest of the money will be used to buy a plot of land on which she will build her house. This will provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to eventually build her house

loans.name: Bordadora Flora Group

texts.es:
The women that make up the “Bordadora Flora” comunal bank arrived at the Friendship Bridge office in the district of Nahuala ten minutes before the meeting was to begin. The members arranged the benches in the shape of a “U” and told the facilitator that they were ready to begin.

The clients would surprise anyone, since the spark they have in their eyes is unusual in many women who live in secluded communities like El Novillero, which is located in a very rural and poor area.

All of the members are well-known as embroiderers in their towns. Their principle occupation is embroidering beautiful traditional blouses. The main colors used in the blouses are lavenders, light blues, maroon, and purple. The combination of these colors with the color of the blouse is incredible. When the women wear these blouses, they give color and life to the streets of El Novillero.

However, four of these clients have more than one business. They have the following types of businesses: buying and selling clothes, a cafeteria, a small basic goods store, and traditional clothing sales.

Marta Tzco commented that she was going to use her loan to buy a refrigerator for her cafeteria. The refrigerator costs $720 and she is going to buy it using her savings from previous months and the loan. Julia E. said that she was going to use her loan to buy approximately 700 boxes of thread. It takes an average of four boxes to embroider one blouse. She expects that with this loan she will be able to embroider 175 blouses.

In addition to the fact that these clients know their businesses well, they would like to acquire new skills in different areas. For example, some would like to learn English, others would like to learn baking, while others would like to learn more about medicine.

The dream of each of the members is to get out of poverty. They simply want to escape from the clutches of a reality that does not allow them to develop to their full potential in different areas of their lives. It is important that we continue to support them so that this simple dream can become a simple reality, so that they can get ahead in life and combat the status quo.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras que integran el banco comunal “Bordadora Flora” llegaron a la oficina de Friendship Bridge en el distrito de Nahuala a tiempo diez minutos antes de que la reunión empiece, las integrantes ubicaron los bancos de plástico en forma de una “U” y le avisaron a la facilitadota que ya estaban listas para empezar.

Estas clientas pueden sorprender a cualquier, ya que la chispa que tienen en los ojos es inusual en muchas mujeres que viven en comunidades retiradas como las de El Novillero, que está ubicada en un área rural y muy pobre.

Todas las integrantes son bordadoras conocidas en sus aldeas. La actividad principal de las Bordadoras Flora es el de bordar bellísimas blusas tradicionales. Los colores principales de estas blusas son lilas, celestes, corinto y morado. La combinación de colores entre los bordados y el color de la blusa es increíble. Estas blusas cuando son usadas por las mujeres colorean y avivan las calles de El Novillero.

Sin embargo, cuatro clientas tienen más de un negocio. Estas clientas tienen un negocio respectivo en las áreas de compra y venta de ropa, cafetería, tienda de consumo diario y venta de ropa típica.

Marta Tzco comentó que iba a usar su préstamo para comprar una refrigeradora para su cafetería. La refrigeradora cuesta $US720 y ella la va a comprar con las ganancias de los meses pasados más su préstamo. Julia E. dijo que ella iba a utilizar su préstamo para comprar aproximada 700 cajas de hilo. Una blusa se puede bordar en promedio con cuatro cajas. Ella proyecta que con ese préstamo va a poder bordar 175 blusas.

Además de que estás clientas conocen bien su negocio, ellas quieren adquirir nuevos conocimientos en distintas áreas. Por ejemplo, algunas quisieran aprender a hablar inglés, otras repostería, mientras que otras les gustaría aprender más sobre medicina.

El sueño de todas las integrantes es salir de la pobreza. Simplemente quieren escapar de las garras de una realidad que no las deja desenvolverse a plenitud en distintos rubros de sus vidas. Es importante que sigamos apoyándolas para que este simple sueño se vuelva en una simple realidad, salir adelante en la vida combatiendo el status quo.

loans.use: To buy thread for embroidery; To buy clothes and traditional clothing for resale; To buy products and ingredients for sale in bakeries and stores

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es:
Señora Francisca Isabel N. M. is a married woman who works with the help of her husband in clothing sales, which has given them good results and a good income, and she has been able to improve the business. She sells clothes in the town of Cinco Pinos in Chinandega by traveling through the streets, and thus exposing herself to the physical exhaustion brought about by the sun.

Now Señora N. has seen good results thanks to her great efforts by going out to sell her merchandise in the community. Presently her need is the prompt acquisition of clothes to sell. It is for this reason she seeks support from Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will allow her to acquire the merchandise to sell and in this way continue to sustain her humble home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Francisca Isabel N. M. es una mujer casada que ha venido desempeñando buena labor con la ayuda de su esposo en su trabajo de venta de ropa el cual le ha dado buenos resultados ya que ha obtenido buenos ingresos y ha mejorado en parte la condición de su negocio. Su venta de ropa la lleva a cabo en el municipio de Cinco Pinos en Chinandega vendiendo ambulantemente por las calles de la comunidad exponiéndose al desgaste físico proporcionado por el sol.

Hoy en día, la señora N. ha visto buenos resultados gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos por salir a vender su mercadería fuera de la comunidad. Actualmente la necesidad que ella atraviesa es la pronta adquisición de la ropa para la venta. Es por ello que busca apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita adquirir de sus proveedores su mercadería para venderla y así continuar con el sustento de su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Mukkadas

texts.ru:
Mukkadas A. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. She is 27 years old and is single. She makes sweet rolls and sells them on the market. She has a small bakery at home. She lives with her parents and helps them. In order for her work to continue uninterrupted she needs to stock up on flower and sugar. For this purpose she would like to obtain a loan that she plans to repay within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдуджалилова Муккадас жительница города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 27 лет . Она не замужем. Занимается выпечкой сдобных булочек и продает на базаре. Имеет небольшую пекарню дома. Она живет сродителями и помогает им. Для того , чтобы работа двигалась бесперебойно ей нужно сделать запас муки и сахара. Поэтому она запланировала получить кредит. Погасить его она сможет в течении12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase flower and sugar

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu A. is forty years old. She is married and is the mother of six children. Two of her children have completed senior high school, while the rest are currently in junior and primary schools.

She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is produced from palm kernel and is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish and pastries. Indeed, she produces and supplies her oil to food vendors so that they can prepare their meals. Although palm kernel oil production is one of the most common occupations among local women in the town of Obuasi, it is nonetheless a lucrative business to be in. However, her oil production has been on the decline in recent months by virtue of the fact that she has very little working capital in order to afford a machine to process the oil. Therefore, she is seeking a loan to buy seventy bags of palm kernel and an electric milling machine to both reduce the need for manual labor in the production process and to produce oil in larger quantities. Ultimately, she feels that this loan will enable her to generate more income to thereby provide food her family and finance her children’s education.

Salamatu belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral in order to access loans and apply peer pressure to ensure that the group members' loans are promptly repaid.

loans.use: To increase production and to make the business more efficient by purchasing additional raw materials (i.e., bags of palm kernel) and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Desarrollo Y Progreso Group

texts.en: Ercilia M. is the leader of her Esperanza International Bank of Hope, Desarrollo y Progreso ("Development and Progress").  She is the mother of four--aged 6,11,13, and 15--and has used her loan to open her shop "Novedades Ercilia," which sells clothes and novelties.  With her future loans she hopes to expand her business and offer her loyal customers more merchandise so that she can ensure that her children are never lacking anything.

loans.use: growing Novedades Ercilia (sale of clothes, food, etc.)

loans.name: Mary A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Mary K.. She is married and has five children aged between 11 and 21. In 2005, Mary established her banana business. She is assisted by her husband. Mary requires a loan in order to purchase more bananas in bulk. In the future, Mary plans to establish another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more banana in bulk.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Саидова Зульфия жительница города Куляб. Возраст 28 лет, незамужем.Зульфия живет с родителями-пенсионерами.Клиентка занимается пошивом  женского платья.Шьет она на заказ, а так же  занимается пошивом платья для продажи на местных  рынках.Имеет опыт в этом деле болеее 2 лет. На кредит хочет закупить ткань.Планирует погасить кредит в тчении 12месяцев.
texts.en:
Zulfiya S. resides in the city of Kulob. She is 28 years old and lives with her retired parents. Zulfiya has more than two years experience in sewing women’s clothing. She both sews to order and makes dresses to sell at the local markets. Zulfiya wishes to purchase fabric with her loan and plans to repay it within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce K., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA EVANGELINA ES MADRE SOLTERA TIENE DOS HIJOS UNO EN EDAD DE KINDER Y LA OTRA PEQUEÑITA DE MESES, ELLA TRABAJA EN UN NEGOCIO EN EL AREA DE VENTAS; ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA COMPRARLE A SU H IJO LOS UTILES ESCOLARES Y ASI LOGRANDO QUE TENGA UN MEJOR DESEMPEÑO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evangelina is a single mother of two children. One of them is a preschooler and the other is just a few months old. She works a business os sales. She is asking for this loan to buy her children school supplies so that he may have a better chance of succeeding.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school supplies for her son

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es socia de Banco Comunal Mar del Plata. 
Marlene es casada, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo de 22 años, el ya terminó el colegio y solo trabaja.
Marlene tiene varios negocios: en la mañana tiene un jugueria en su casa (desde marzo), en la noche vende hamburguesas en su casa (desde muchos años) y también tiene un combi con su esposo. 
Marlene necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en su mercadería, comprará insumos para su negocio.
Marlene desde que recibe los préstamos ha podido invertir mas.
Marlene sueña con crecer con  sus negocios.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the communal bank Mar del Plata. Marlene is 39 years old, is married and has a 22 year old son. Her son is out of school and only works. Marlene has several businesses: in the mornings she sells juices from her home (since March); in the evenings she sells hamburgers from her home (she has done this for several years) and she also has a taxi service with her husband. Marlene needs a loan in the amount of $275 which she will invest in her merchandise and buying supplies for her business. Since she has received these loans Marlene has been able to invest more. She dreams of expanding her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Taj Mai Haq Nawaz Group

texts.en:
Taj Mai baji is a 38-year-old lady and resides in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 10 years. She is the mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters. Her eldest son is a ticket checker. The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Taj mai baji’s husband's name is H. N.; he is a driver and drives a truck for farming. Taj baji runs a shop where she sells seasonal vegetables. She has been running this shop for the past 15 years. Taj baji is applying for a loan to buy new wheels for her husband’s truck so that he able to continue his work.

She is the group leader and is joined by several more members from her locality. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling. Mansab mai baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Nasreen mai baji and Bashiran mai baji each want a loan to buy fertilizer to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for her husband's truck

loans.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
La señora María Lusmila, es socia del BC “Los Jazmines”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito D. Moyabamba. Se dedica a la venta D. mercería como ungüentos, desodorantes, betún, tijeras y artículos D. limpieza. Desarrolla su negocio en las afueras del mercado central D. la ciudad, también sale a recorrer los alrededores y dentro del mercado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará   escobillas, crema dental, peines, afeitadores, ungüentos, desodorantes D. diferentes marcas y presentaciones, pilas D. diferentes tamaños y demás productos que tiene mayor salida. Quiere surtir bien su negocio y contar con lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades D. sus clientes.

María Lusmila tiene 69 años D. edad, es madre D. 04 hijos quienes ya son independientes, ahora ella vive con su esposo y con sus dos nietas que son estudiantes y a quienes está criando, además la ayudan atender el negocio. Su meta es poner su negocio en su casa.
texts.en:
María Lusmila is a member of Los Jazmines community bank. She lives in Región San Martín in Moyabama district and province. María sells merchandise such as ointment, deodorant, shoe polish, scissors and cleaning products. Her business has grown on the outskirts of the city’s central market. She travels to both neighboring areas and within the market itself. With this loan of $350 (1000 Peruvian nuevos soles), which will be repaid in six month, María will buy brushes, toothpaste, combs, shaving cream, various brands and types of deodorant, batteries in a variety of sizes and other popular products. She wants to increase her inventory in order to have on hand the necessities to meet the customer demand. Maria Lusmila is 69 years old and the mother of four grown children. At present she lives with her husband and the two grandchildren that they are raising. The grandchildren are still in school, but they also help her tend to the business. Maria’s goal is to run the business out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of brushes, toothpaste, combs, shaving cream, deodorant, batteries and other products

loans.name: Marililiana

texts.es: Marililiana tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos, sus hermanos y sus padres, en la casa de estos últimos. La venta de bebidas heladas y dar una buena atención a sus clientes es su rutina diaria, debido a que se encuentra ubicada en un lugar apropiado dentro de su zona, se siente feliz porque concurre mucha gente de varios lugares a su negocio. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 2 años y todo este tiempo le ha sido rentable porque debido al calor de la zona de selva, que es donde ella vive, todos los días las personas están en busca de bebidas heladas, ya sean cervezas o gaseosas. Este es el primer crédito que tiene Marililiana con MFP, y la cantidad que está solicitando es para la compra de mayor cantidad de cervezas,  y de mesas y sillas para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marililiana is 28 years old, a single mother of two children, and lives with her parents and brothers in their house. Her daily routine involves selling cold drinks and providing good service to her customers, given that she is well-located within her zone. She feels content because many people visit her place of business. She has been conducting this activity for two years and, over this period of time, it has been profitable because of the heat of the jungle zone where she lives. Each day, customers arrive looking for cold drinks – both beer and soda. This is Marililiana’s first loan with MFP and the amount she is requesting is for the purchase of a greater quantity of beers, as well as chairs and tables to better accommodate her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase drinks and furniture for her business.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru:
Каримова Нилуфар, 1986 года рождения. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность она начала в 2002 году. Она шьет национальные платья и штаны. У них семейный бизнес и партнером  по бизнесу является ее мать, которая очень хорошо знает эту профессию. У них много клиентов. В сезон они шьют по заказу, а зимой покупают отрезы, шьют платья и штаны, которых закупают продавцы с рынка «Корвон» для перепродажи. Нилуфар шьет платья из разных материалов и разных фасонов (кувшин, цветок, хлопок, сердце).
В сезон свадебных мероприятий увеличивается спрос на шитье разнообразных национальных платьев. В такие моменты клиенту необходимы дополнительные средства. для приобретения материалов и фурнитуры. Для этого она хочет получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони и погасить его в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nilufar K. was born in 1986. She started her entrepreneurial venture in 2002. She sews traditional dresses and trousers. They have a family business and her business partner is her mother who knows this profession very well. They have many clients. In season they sew to order and in the winter they purchase fabric pieces and sew dresses and trousers, which are purchased by sellers from the “Korvon” market for resale. Nilufar sews dresses from different fabrics and in different styles (pitcher, flower, cotton, heart). During wedding season demand increases for a variety of traditional dresses. At these times the client needs additional resources to purchase fabric and accessories. She would like to borrow $425 (1500 somoni) for this purpose and will pay the loan back over 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread

loans.name: Perina

texts.en:
Perina N. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Perina is 39 years old and is married with a husband who is an accountant. She has 2 children and they both go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand a bread-selling business

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor V. is engaged in the pig business. He has a sow which bears piglets that he sells to other pig growers. Raising pigs is a common livelihood in his area. People love pork so much, which maintains the high demand for meat. Melchor has regular buyers of his small pigs. His pig business is what he uses to support his parents. He is 34 years old and still single. Someday, he will marry and that is why he started to save for his future family.

Melchor is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy feed for his pigs. The loan will help him grow his pig business. He is interested, also, to venture into other possible income areas. In that way, he believes he could better help his parents and his siblings.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start-up and have their own business. They not only provide credit, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aída, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en el Jr. Apolonia con Jorge Chávez S/Nº - Caserío de El Porvenir del  Distrito de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 01 que aun depende de ella.Es socia en Manuela Ramos, pues tiene  casi 07 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal, se dedica al rubro de corte y confección de vestidos, se inicio con un préstamo de S/. 200.00 Nuevos Soles con el que compró un poco de material para sus confecciones, que por su buen acabado se hizo de una clientela segura.En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, que los ofrece a sus clientes, vecinos y amigos conocidos, asimismo trabaja con pedidos a medidas, otra de las actividades a la que se dedica es  la preparación y venta de quesos.Con este préstamo de S/. 900.00 que cancelara en 04 meses, lo invertirá comprando telas de algodón en metros; hilos en diferentes colores, elásticos, blondas,  insumos necesarios  para confeccionar ropas interiores en diferentes tallas y modelos para damas,  caballeros y niños.Es ella quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Nos cuenta que hoy se siente una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene metas en su vida como son  implementar su propio taller con un local amplio y acondicionado.Aída, nos comenta que Manuela Ramos le permitió crecer como empresaria y Mujer, y esta muy agradecida con su apoyo.
texts.en:
Aida belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" communal bank. She lives on the corner of Jr. Apolonia and Jorge Chávez, in the village of El Porvenir in the Bellavista district, department of San Martín. She is married, 53 years old and the mother of 3 children, 1 of who still depends financially on her. She is a member of Manuela Ramos and has been working with her communal bank for almost 7 years. She is a dressmaker and started off with a loan of S/. 200 Nuevos Soles, with which she bought some material to make clothing, which due to its quality resulted in steady customers. She is currently working in the same business, offering her servicies to clients, neighbors, friends and acquaintenances. She also works on commission. Another of her activities is making and selling cheeses. With a loan for S/. 900 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy several meters of cotton material, thread in different colors, elastic, lace, and supplies she needs to make undergarments in different sizes and styles for women, men and children. She makes her own decisions regarding the earnings from her business. Today she considers herself a fighter and an entrepreneur and she has goals for herself, such as setting up her own workshop in a spacious storefront. Aida says that Manuela Ramos has allowed her to grow as a businesswoman and as a woman, and she is very grateful for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cotton material

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A., 40 years old, is married and the mother of six children. She is a food vendor who prepares and sells tea (or coffee) served with bread and fried eggs. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. Their education is possible through the government's free compulsory education system.

Christina is dedicated to providing a better future for the children. She has sold tea and bread in her neighborhood for many years now. Her service is patronized by many people in the community. Her only problem is that she needs more funds to buy loaves of bread from the bakers as well as other foodstuffs. It is her desire to expand her food operations, so she has requested a loan to support the purchase of items like bread, margarine, and sugar.

She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nkwa Nsuo,’ which translates as "living waters."

loans.use: To buy items like bread, Milo, sugar, margarine, and pure water for her food vending business.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra baji is the wife of M. S. who owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 15 years. She operates a paranda-making business. A paranda is an item used to tie the hair tightly. Women of Pakistan use them to tie their hair. Azra baji learned this art from her mother.

Azra baji prepares different kinds of parandas, e.g. embroidered and simple. She makes them from thread. Azra baji is applying for a loan to buy material (thread and beads) to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy thread and beads for her paranda-making business

loans.name: Belta

texts.es:
La señora Belta, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Estrellitas II”, vive en el Jr. Ricardo Palma Nº 1270, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años, y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella (son su gran orgullo).

Belta, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino, las ganas de salir adelante le dieron buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.  Se inició vendiendo cosméticos de diferentes líneas como Unique, Esika, Leonisa y Avon, negocio con el que continua. 
Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo una vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Belta, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Belta belongs to the communal bank “Las Estrellitas II” (The Little Stars II) She lives at 1270 Jr. Ricardo Palma Street located in the district of Tarapoto, in the province of San Martín and in the department de San Martín. She is married, is 39 years old and has two children that she provides for. They are the great pride of her life. Belta is a woman that has been able to overcome many difficulties in her life. She has a strong desire to make a better life for herself and her family. Today she has a business that she runs and she is very happy and proud of herself. She sells cosmetic products for different companies like Unique, Esika, Leonisa and Avon. With the loan of $350 she will invest in buying more beauty products to sell like perfumes for women, cologne for men, lotions, compacts, lipsticks, nail polishes and also a display window to put her products behind. Belta is a mature and responsible woman and she serves as an example for many women entrepreneurs. She shows that people can make their dreams come true by having perseverance.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics to increase her stock.

loans.name: Mrs. Bunthy Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Thma Kor village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Bunthy S. is the 50- year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to grow mangoes. Now she has an obstacle because her field is infertile and has suffered insect damage. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to enable her mangoe production to be better. She hopes to increase her income and production. Her husband, Mr. Nouv Sam Oul, is a teacher in the local school. They have a child who is employed in a garment factory. All of them are presented in the picture but some of them are blocked.

Six members in this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. The members with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her mango farm

loans.name: Jorie

texts.en: Jorie J. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 28 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three school-aged children. Jorie owns and operates a variety store in their community, selling various products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jorie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Jorie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Мухаббат Гафурова – женщина 47 лет. Замужем и мать 5-х детей. Она занимается продажей детских игрушек на Центральном рынке Джаббор-Расуловкого района. Мухаббат закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром 2 раза в месяц. Её муж Гафуров Абдусаттор мастер строительных работ. Он тоже зарабатывает неплохо, но по мере требования взрослых детей, ему не удаётся накапливать деньги. Мухаббат уже 3 года занимается этим бизнесом. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас она расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию мягких игрушек . Теперь у Мухаббат увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Muhabbat G. is a 47-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 5 children. She sells children's toys at the Central market of the Jabbor-Rasulov district. Muhabbat buys her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. She goes there twice per month. Her husband, Abdusattor Gafurov, is a master builder. He also earns well, but due to the needs of the older children, he is unable to save money. Muhabbat has been involved in this business for 3 years. When she first started, she had a small quantity of merchandise, but expanded her selection since then. She used her last loan to purchase a stock of plush toys. Now Muhabbat's merchandise selection increased.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toys

loans.name: Mariela Catherina

texts.es:
Mariela es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Mariela es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Mariela viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Mariela tiene proyectado implementar una tienda de abarrotes.
Mariela necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Mariela son sacar adelante a sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Mariela is a member of the Wiñarasun Village Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in the Quechua language. She is 36, married, and has three children. She travels around to the different markets in her region buying grains, which she then sells at the wholesale market in the city of Ayacucho. She has plans to open a grocery store. Mariela is seeking a loan for 1000 soles to purchase rice and sugar. She dreams of getting her children ahead and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sokchoun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokchoun P., age 18, and her husband, Mr. Sienghour Try, age 20, were just married in 2008. They live with their parents in a small village off of National Road number Two about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sokchoun is a garment factory worker, but she stopped working for a while because she is pregnant. Mr. Sienghour is a truck driver. He is hired by people to transport sand, excavated dirt, sandstone and so on, using his own truck. Recently, his truck broke down, which upset his business. That’s why Sokchoun is applying for her first loan of $300 to add to her own money for repairing the truck for her husband. Then he will be able to continue his business.

loans.use: To add to her own money for repairing her husband's truck.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, now 59 years old, lives in the village of Punit Benito Soliven, Isabela.  She has been a widow for four years, while her only son passed away due to an accident already fifteen years ago. 

To keep herself busy, Erlinda got involved in the food snacks sales business: she sells banana cue and ripe banana, vegetables, fruit, and meat from a stall in front of her house.  She would now like to expand the business in order to be able to save some income for future emergency use.  Erlinda is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 to use as additional capital for the business expansion.  ”As long as I have the strength to work, I will do my best to be productive while enjoying life, because it is so short,” she also shares.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk for  her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard at her trade, selling rice, and hopes to increase her income by buying more sacks of rice to sell. She is committed to expand her business, and has applied for this loan to make that expansion possible.

Dolores is 58 years old and lives in the town of Palattao in Naguilian, Isabela. She is happily married to Benito, a farmer. They have three children, two of whom are married. Dolores aims to improve her way of life by working hard at her trade.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Thouk I. is an older woman and a widowed mother of four children. Her husband died of senility years ago.  

Two of her children are married and live independently, while other two are single. Thouk I. has been working as a rice farmer since her children were very young. Currently, she owns a piece of land, on which she cultivates different crops to earn a living. To help meet the family’s financial needs, one of her daughters is working for a hotel. Thouk I. saw that her daughter was having difficulty commuting to work because she doesn’t own a vehicle. So Thouk I. decided to seek a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha K. lives in Vihear village in Takeo province. She is a duck breeder. Since her poultry business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks to breed. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Vong Seourn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Chantha K. is the mother of six children, one of whom is a laborer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 31 years old and married. She has three children between the ages of nine and fourteen. Dorothy sells shoes and textiles and also provides tailoring services. She describes herself as hard-working and committed.

Dorothy successfully repaid a previous loan of Kes. 20,000 from Faulu. She is requesting this loan of Kes. 40,000 to purchase more stock. She says that through Faulu's training, she has learned to manage her business more professionally. In the future, she hopes to open a boutique and also sell her goods wholesale.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roberto el cliente vive en su propia parcela con sus padres que se dedican tambien a la agricultura y sus hermanos el tiene un hijo de tres años.

El destino del crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en su siembra,para despues comercializar sus productos en el mercado de la zona, el señor esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo y confianza depositada.
texts.en:
Roberto lives on his own small farm with his parents who work also in agriculture and his siblings. He has a 3-year-old son. He applied for a loan to finance his sowing. He will sell his farm products at the regional market. Roberto thanks the microfinance institution Emprender for its support and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Luz Marlene

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Alborada.
Luz es soltera, tiene 37 años y 1 hija, trabaja en el hospital regional como personal administrativo, Luz tiene un kiosco al frente del hospital en donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su hermano.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Luz son terminar sus estudios de Administración y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Alborada Communal Bank. She is 37 years old, single, and has a daughter. She works in the regional hospital in an administrative capacity. She has a stand across from the hospital where she sells food and drink. Her brother helps her with her business. Luz needs a loan of 900 soles, to buy rice and sugar. Her dream is to complete her studies in management and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Nei

texts.en:
Mrs. Nei Keom is 46 years old and she lives in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sok Sao, are farmers who own 1.5-hectar field to cultivate rice. In order to support the rice field, Mrs. Ne Keom decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, gasoline and to pay for hired labor. With the rest of the loan, she would buy pig food for pig breeding because aside from the plantation, she is a pig breeder. 

Mrs. Ne Keom, is the mother of three children, two of whom are students at the local school, while the youngest is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for a rice farm and pay for hired labor, and to buy feed for pigs

loans.name: Pedro
