S/ 1,800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, implementó su negocio, compró una vitrina para que pueda exhibir sus productos D. belleza, también comprará perfumes, desodorantes, colonias, talcos, joyas, etc. Teresa se siente muy bien con el préstamo recibido por que le ayuda a seguir creciendo su negocio, y así pueD. cumplir sus metas y sus sueños. Teresa quiere vender tarjetas y celulares; y así pueda ayudarle a pagar sus estudios a sus hijos sobre todo a uno que esta en la universidad.

loans.use: To buy a display case and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rehema R.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Rehema M.. She is married and has two children aged 8 and 12. She has one dependent who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2005, Rehema established her genge business. Rehema requires a loan in order to buy additional stock of home needs items. She thanks you for your support.

Genge

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy additional basic staples for re-sale

loans.name: Mwanakhamis

texts.en:
MwanaK. is 50 years old and is divorced with a 25 year old. She has been selling food since 2005. She works everyday from 6am to 7pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

MwanaK. now requests a loan to buy more food items like rice, maize flour, meat, vegetables and bananas for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio tiene 47 años, vive solo, ya que está divorciado de su pareja, con la cual tiene una hija de 13 años.  Se dedica al negocio de la construcción desde hace 26 años, desde muy joven apoyó en obras de construcción, aprendiendo los secretos de este oficio, al cual se dedica a tiempo completo, ya que la obras en las cuales trabaja exigen mucho tiempo y dedicación para ser concluidas, usualmente, empieza una jornada laboral a las 7 de la mañana hasta aproximadamente las 6 de la tarde.  A Gregorio siempre le ha gustado trabajar, el construir y ver que una obra está finalizada, además saber que él participó en la creación de ese trabajo, hace que sienta gratificación por su trabajo, por otro lado el trabajo es muy duro y le exige gran esfuerzo físico.  Gregorio trabaja mucho para brindarle a  su única hija, Lucía, un mejor porvenir.   Con el dinero solicitado, quiere comprar materiales propios de albañilería para también poder trabajar de forma independiente.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 47 years old, lives alone, is divorced from his wife with whom they have a 13 year old daughter. He has been in the construction business for 26 years. Since he was very young, Gregorio has helped with construction works projects, learning the secrets of the trade to which he works full time. The projects that he works on require a lot of time to be completed and he usually begins a work day at 7 in the morning and finishes at about 6 in the afternoon. Gregorio has always enjoyed working in construction and being able to see a completed work and knows that he has participated in its creation is something that gives him personal gratification in his work and, at the same time, the work is very demanding and requires great physical labor. Gregorio will continue working to provide a better future for his only daughter, Lucía. With the money requested in this loan, he would like to purchase new building materials such as bricks so that he can also work independently.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction supplies in order to work as an independent bricklayer/builder.

loans.name: Merci

texts.es: Merci tiene 30 años de edad, es madre de un hijo que está estudiando, en la actualidad vive junto con su esposo, quien le da la mano en sus objetivos trazados. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza, en su casa desde hace 3 años, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a mucha gente con quien comparte ideas. Este negocio  le es muy rentable, ya que fortalece un poco más su nivel económico y porque trabaja con una marca muy reconocida que tiene los precios cómodos al gusto del cliente. Su negocio no tiene dificultad alguna y le va excelente. Es su 7mo préstamo en MFP. Con el dinero que pide quiere mandar a construir su pequeño bar al costado de su casa y desde luego implementarse con más productos cerveceros de otras calidades.
texts.en:
Merci is 30 years old, is the mother of one son who is in school, and currently lives with her husband who gives her a hand in the objectives she sets. She has worked selling beer for the past 3 years and she likes her job because she meets many people with whom she shares ideas. This business is very profitable, as it already strengthens her economic level a little and because she works with a very recognized brand that has comfortable prices to her clients' liking. Her business does not have any difficulty and it is going excellently. It is her seventh loan in MFP. With the money that she is requesting she will have a small bar built on the side of her house and then add more beer products of other qualities.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a location for her business

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch V., 32, is married and resides with her husband and two young children in the Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling various kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make US$ 2 in profit a day, while her husband, 34, is a motor-taxi driver. Every day, he operates around the market near his house and generally produces US$ 2 in profit as well. Two of their children are students. 

Touch V. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run his motor-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Klang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The group receiving this village bank loan consists of twenty people I. Thnal village I. Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thy K. is a village bank president. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep I. stock and then resell later at a better price. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to keep I. stock. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Uk Kry, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Thy K. is 48 years old and the mother of four children who all attend the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allow people to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more rice to keep in stock

loans.name: Ahmad Zaki

texts.en:
Ahmad Zaki is the son of A. M. and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has two children. He is a hard-working man who is confident that he can work well.

He has a shop in which he sells car parts and oil for cars. He wants to take out an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to purchase additional materials to expand his business. He hopes to be a good businessman in the future to support the family and his society. He is very happy about this loan program.

loans.use: To expand his car business

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.en: Mrs. Inocenta A., 64 years old, is married and lives at Butuay, Jimenez, Mis. Occidental. She has 2 children. Her husband is a village electrician and a farmer. In order to help her husband, she decided to raise pigs for additional income. Mrs. A. heard of Paglaum MPC and joined the cooperative because of the benefits given to members aside from loans. She already availed herself of loans several times, being a Member in Good Standing. Now, she applies for PHP 14,900 to buy sacks of feed for daily consumption by her pigs. Someday she wants to raise more pigs for sale and to own a piggery. She plans also to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy sacks of animal feeds

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yesica es una mujer emnprendedora que incio su negocio de venta de zapatos para poder ayudar a su familia y salir adelante con los gastos de sus 3 hijos, asi como poder brindarles mejor calidad de vida. 

Poco a poco gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado hacerse de  clientes, iniico vendideno solo entre sus familiares y amigos y ellos la han ido recomendando por lo que su cartera de clientes ha crecido y asi ha incrementado sus ventas, ahora ella necesita de un prestamo por MXN $4,000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas para comprar mercancia. Con tu apoyo ella podra continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesica is an enterprising woman who started her shoe sale business to help her family and come out ahead with the expenses of her three children. She also wants to provide them a better quality of life. Little by little, thanks to her own efforts she has achieved establishing a clientele. She started by selling to her family and friends, and they have been recommending her thereby increasing her client portfolio and her sales. All she needs now is a loan for MXN $4000 that she will pay off in 10 two-week installments to buy merchandise. With your help she will continue operating her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jonathan Bradshaw, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 47-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their seven children. Ali has owned a butcher shop for nineteen years. He requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to start a new business, a bakery. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. 

Ali's first business is a butcher shop. He is special in this work because he has good meat. His clients come from around his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have enough start-up capital. He decided to start a new business because he wanted to improve his family's financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and starting the new bakery.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María C. ya ha tenido más de cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales pago puntual mente. Tiene  dedicándose a su negocio de renta de mesas y sillas para fiesta y también renta de  equipo de sonio, es el ingreso de su familia. 
 Desea nuevamente un préstamo para la compra de un equipo de sonido mas moderno ya que el anterior que tenia ya esta en malas condiciones, y no puede trabajar hasta que adquiera otro mejor y mas moderno.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria C. has now had more than four loans with FVP which she has paid punctually. She has dedicated herself to her business of renting tables and chairs for parties, as well as renting stereo equipment, it is the income for her family. She now wants a loan for the purchase of more modern stereo equipment now that the equipment she currently owns is in poor condition, and she can’t work until she acquires better and more modern equipment.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of stereo equipment

loans.name: Donia

texts.es: Donia cuenta con 29 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene tres hijos. En su piel curtida se refleja su trabajo en el campo, el que realiza muy contenta en compañía de su esposo; mientras él recoge las papas de la tierra, ella las selecciona de acuerdo al tamaño. Por ello, le pagan a diario 12 soles, por una jornada de 8.00am a 5.00pm, y a su pareja 15 soles. Estos trabajos los realizan generalmente durante las fechas de cosecha; pero pasada esta temporada se dedican a trabajar sus propios cultivos donde siembran papa y alverjas en las chacras de sus suegros y otro tanto, en terrenos alquilados, con la finalidad de hacer que sus siembras se conviertan en rentables y puedan adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivos. Donia es la tesorera de su banco comunal, al que le tiene mucho aprecio por los préstamos consecutivos que le facilitó MFP, este es su 9no crédito y en todo este tiempo demostró ser muy responsable en sus pagos. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes, para la siembra de papas; así como productos que combatan las diversas enfermedades de la papa.
texts.en:
Donia, 29, lives with her partner with whom she has three children. Her well-tanned skin is a reflection of the work she does on the farm, work that she does happily, side-by-side with her husband. While he picks the potatoes in the field, she sorts them according to size. She's paid 12 soles a day for her work, a day that stretches from 8:00am to 5:00pm, and her partner, 15 soles. They generally do this work during the harvest season. This year, though, they're cultivating their own crop, planting potatoes and peas in a field owned by in-laws, as well as land that they've rented, with a goal of turning the crop into an income and buying their own land in the future. Donia is the treasurer of her community bank. She greatly appreciates the loans that she's received from MFP in the past and this is her 9th loan. She's shown herself to be responsible in repaying the loans. The money that she's borrowing will be used to buy fertilizers for the potato crop, along with other products for fighting various potato plant diseases.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for farming business.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia baji is the wife of G. H. who owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the last 14 years.

She and her husband belong to a decorative embroidery business. Her husband takes orders from the clothes shops and then they both prepare embroidered dresses. They complete one dress in 13 days and earn income.

Nazia baji is applying for a loan to buy material (beads,colored thread and cloth) to complete the orders.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Khiev O., 53, (husband in photo) is a mother who cares for five children. Khiev and her husband work as farmers.

One of her daughters sells clothes. Khiev will use her loan to improve her daughter’s clothes business, to better meet customer’s demands.

loans.use: Support daughter’s clothes selling business,

loans.name: Tuhfaniso

texts.ru: Тухфанисо – 51 год. Замужем и мать 2-х детей. Она занимается продажей разных тканей для национальных платьев.  Она торгует на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Тухфанисо закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  2 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Тухфанисо за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней ткани штапель.
texts.en:
Tuhfaniso is 51-years old and she is married with two children. She sells fabric for national costumes. She works at Gafurov's Farovon market. Tuhfaniso buys goods at Istaravshan's wholesale market and in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. Twice a month she travels to Istaravshan and once a month to Bishkek. She would like to use the loan for the purchase of new fabric for the summer season.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric retail

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La señora Elsa tiene su tienda muy surtida en la  zona  de Pampahasi, vive ahí mismo, ya que es casa propia, está haciendo construir un departamento, el crédito será invertido en la compra de vigas prefabricadas ya que está en la última fase de la construcción. Vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que están en edad escolar.Es una cliente puntual.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa has a well-stocked store in the area of Pampahasi. She lives there and is building an apartment. The credit will be invested in the purchase of pre-fabricated beams for the last phase of construction. She lives with her husband and two school-aged children. She is a punctual client.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will invest in construction materials.

loans.name: Benkadi  De Fofanabougou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe BENKADI sont des hommes mariés ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à FOFANABOUGOU  un des villages de la commune rurale de FANA, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Ils viennent de commencer leur collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir réaliser les activités hivernales. Ils font exclusivement la culture du maïs qui reste la  culture dominante de la zone. 
Par rapport à l’utilisation de ce prêt, ils comptent acheter, des semences, des intrants, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 5 hectares. Ils s’approvisionnent essentiellement sur le marché hebdomadaire de la ville de FANA.
La production est vendue au niveau de Fana, Tingolé, après les récoltes, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Ils comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group BENKADI are married men who average 36 years of age and 3 children.  The men live in polygamous families in FOFANABOUGOU, a village in the rural community of FANA, sub-prefecture of FANA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members just started collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of being able to carry out their winter-time work.  They grow corn exclusively which remains the dominant crop of the area.  Regarding the use of this loan, they intend to buy seeds, fertilizers and the like, and minor farm supplies and equipment. They also intend to cover the cost of labor for maintaining 5 hectares.  Supplies are gotten essentially from the weekly market of the city of FANA.  After the harvests, the produce is sold in Fana, Tingolé, to customers composed of men and women.  The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA after the planting campaign.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang K., age 30, is married and has two young children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a business of weaving, typically earning an income of US $3 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family to generate better source of income for his family. To make a living, he is engaged in a business as a taxi driver providing his services to people from his province to the city, earning US $3 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, K. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, K. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 for her husband to purchase car tires to replace his old car tires. By doing so, his car will be efficiently comfortable for his passengers and safe for his driving.

loans.use: car tire purchase

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate K. is 42 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in secondary school. For the past ten years she has run a grocery business in Kayirikiti Local Council in Nyendo Masaka district. Immaculate is requesting a loan to purchase grocery items such as sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice. She wants to increase her stock levels of these products so that she can make more profit and meet customer demand. Her business dream is to expand and become successful in her business, but her main desire is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items such as sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and rice

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 22 years old. She is a young mother with a one-year-old baby named Jerome. She is happily married to Renato Jr., a passenger-tricycle driver. They are presently residing in Cabisera 9-11 of Ilagan, Isabela, an isolated and mountainous village. Jennifer feels the need to work hard to sustain their daily needs. Sometimes, when there is someone to take care of her child, she works on a farm just to obtain a daily income from farm labor amounting to $2.25 a day. She hopes that someday she’ll be able to manage her own business. For now, Jennifer is requesting a loan amounting to PHP18,000 for the maintenance and repair of her husband's passenger-tricycle. She hopes that lenders will support the needs of her family by helping to increase their income.

loans.use: Tricycle repair

loans.name: Iris Margarita

texts.es: Iris Margarita O. M. de 25 años de edad reside en El Refuguio del departamento de Ahuachapán. Iris vive con su madre, esposo y su hijo Elías de 3 años de edad. Iris tiene seis años de tener su negocio, una tienda con productos para el hogar y de consumo, ahora Iris ha expandido su negocio con la venta de cosméticos ya que son rápidamente vendidos, el crédito que hoy solita es por ello para surtir de cosméticos y otros productos para su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria B. is from the village of Garang Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Maria is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dry goods in the local community. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily needs.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 06 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
"Nụ N. Thị lives in the town of Thanh Hoá and is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 06 Đông Sơn (06 Đông Sơn).


Nụ is 42 years old and married with 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Nụ owns and operates a general store.  The main source of income for the business is selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Nụ has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 1500000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2006, Nụ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nụ from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  L. Thị Tuyết (90) is a 59 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store operations.


2.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Algaa

texts.en:
Algaa is a widower who lives in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. He lives alone in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and operates a religious goods retail business in his town. He began his business in 2007 with working capital of 250,000 tugrugs (about $170) and with several years of hard work, he has managed to increase his working capital to exceed 1,200,000 tugrugs (about $840). With the success of his business, he has managed to purchase a car and establish himself in the business community. Algaa is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of religious goods for his business. About XacBank XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of religious goods for his business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled has owned a coffee shop since 2005. He’s 31 years old. Today, Khaled is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy merchandise; this loan will help him keep up his business activities by increasing his sales as well as his income.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Celsa Francisca

texts.es: Celsa Francisca tiene 50 años de edad, ella es una persona  que le gusta mucho su trabajo. Su actividad económica es una sastrería por lo que ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 34 años cuando decidió comprar una maquina de costura y posteriormente por medio de una amiga que le brindo algo de dinero para confeccionar algunos de sus trajes y así fue que incremento poco a poco su capital de trabajo pues desde un inicio fue muy difícil porque no tenía todas las herramientas necesarias para mejorar sus ingresos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de agujas, hilos, telas y alfileres. Ella sueña con mejorar cada día la calidad de sus prendas y además en mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Celsa Francisca is 50 years old and is someone who loves her job. She owns a tailor shop which she has been dedicated to since 34 years ago when she decided to buy a sewing machine and a friend loaned her some money to make some suits. This is how her business grew, little by little, but it was difficult at the start because she did not have all the tools necessary to better her earnings. The financing she requests will be for the purchase of needles, threads, cloths, and pins. She dreams every day of increasing the quality of her goods and of bettering her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Material for Sewing and Tailoring

loans.name: Nery

texts.es:
Nery, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 53 años, es madre de cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de cigarros y tabaco, la elaboración la realiza en su casa con el apoyo de sus hijos, luego los lleva a vender en el mercado Bellavista, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura. Nery forma parte del Banco Comunal “Manos Maravillosas” desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la elaboración de cigarros. 
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de tabaco. La meta de Nery es tener una bodega en su casa que le permita obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nery, 53, is a very hard-working woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district, Ucayali region. She has five children, two of whom are adults. She makes and sells cigars and tobacco, an activity she undertakes in her own home with help from her children. She then takes the products to the Bellavista market to sell. Her husband, who is a farmer, supports her work endeavors. Nery has been a member of the "Manos Maravillosas" communal bank for four years. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used in cigar manufacturing. She now needs 500 soles to buy tobacco. Nery's goal is to have a store in her home that will allow her to earn higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tobacco.

loans.name: Ostad Qasem Group

texts.en:
The Ostad Qasem group has four members. The group leader, Geti, is 34 years old, and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan.  She has three children.  Geti is seeking a loan to help develop her husband's dried-fruit business. Fawzya wants a loan to buy materials for her husband’s fresh-fruit business.  Norya and Nasera are seeking a loan for their tailoring business.  They need money to buy sewing materials and a new machine to replace one that doesn't work properly. The group members are confident that they can do the repayments on time.

 They would like to thank the Kiva lenders that support the entrepreneurs around Afghanistan.

loans.use: To help develop a dried-fruit business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica sells groceries such as milk, noodles, bread, biscuits, juice and sachet water. She started this business 2 years ago and she is recording progress daily. She is married with two children, a set of twins who are 3 years old. Monica is 33 years old and lives in Sapele, Delta State with her family. She supports her husband in meeting the family's needs. Her husband works with the local government. Monica needs a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a 50-year-old single mother of seven. Three of her children go to school. She owns a four-room house, where she lives with six people. Deborah takes care of additional family members. Her family has access to electricity and piped water, and they get three meals a day.

Deborah doesn't incur any transportation costs in shopping for her business, as she buys from her place of work from delivery trucks. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Deborah works seven days a week. She receives an average of 25 customers per day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing price of beer and the rainy season, which hinders her customers' ability to reach her, because she works in an open place. She has been in this business for twelve years

Deborah's monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and medication. She has been with MCDT for ten years, and they are servicing her twentieth loan. Deborah joined MCDT because it was easy to work with and near her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of beer. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger, and she would like to start selling on wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer

loans.name: Ovoke

texts.en: Ovoke is 36 years old, married, and has five children. Her children attend school, which gives her joy. Ovoke sells baby things, jewelry and drinks to make a living and has been in this business for a long time. With these combined businesses, she hopes to meet the basic needs of her family. Her husband also works to support their home. Ovoke is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more baby things, jewelry and drinks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby things, jewelry and drinks to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu K. is 42 years old, married, with four children, three girls and one boy. The eldest is working, the second one is in secondary school, and the youngest is in primary school. She sells provisions and coal in Wilberforco, very close to the market, where she stays with her family.

She has been a LAPO, SL client for almost 2 years now, and has taken out three previous loans, which she used to invest in the same type of busness as provisions and coal. She then used the profits to take care of her family. Isatu is asking for a new loan of 2,000,000 Leones from LAPO, SL. With the help of Kiva lenders, she will be able to improve her busness and assist her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to pay for provisions and coal.

loans.name: 070905-Hoằng Hoá, Thanh Hoá Group

texts.en: Khuyên Lê Thị (709051) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Hoằng Hoá, Thanh Hoá. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 07.09.05- Hoằng T.nh- Hoằng Hoá- Thanh Hoá (07.09.05). Khuyên is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month. In 2007, Khuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. Khuyên is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND which will again be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 4th from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Lê Thị Dung (709052) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. 2. Lê Thị Hương (709053) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5,000,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Khuyên Lê Thị (709051) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở Hoằng Hoá - Thanh Hoá. Khuyên là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 07.09.05- Hoằng T.nh- Hoằng Hoá- Thanh Hoá (07.09.05). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. Khuyên thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Khuyên kiếm được khoảng 1500000 VND. Vào 2007, Khuyên đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Khuyên đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Lê Thị Dung (709052) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. Lê Thị Hương (709053) là 46 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ganga Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Ganga Maiya M. makes a living selling groceries in the village of Thecho. She opened a store in her home seven years ago as a way to improve her family's living conditions, and now sells a range of items such as rice, maize, noodles and biscuits. In order to help meet rising demand from her customers, she has applied for a loan to invest in her small business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Segundo Baltazar

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos, vive con su esposa y el ultimo de sus hijos en el sector Carlos Stein del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, un distrito próximo a la ciudad de Chiclayo considerado el distrito mas poblado de la región, pero también el que presenta mayores indices de pobreza.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la venta de frutas y golosinas en un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado frente al terminal terrestre de la ciudad de Chiclayo, el negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida ya que la zona diariamente es frecuentada por bastantes personas que viajan hacia pueblos del interior de la región. El le dedica todo el dia a esta actividad y con las ganancias que percibe solventa los gastos familiares.

Segundo desea implementar su negocio con la compra de más fruta, ya que este es el producto que goza de mayor demanda en su negocio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por pirmera vez a Edyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Segundo es una persona trabajadora y que siempre ha velado por el progreso y bienestar de los suyos, sus compañeros de trabajo y vecinos coinciden en que el es alguien honrado, responsable y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar a los que le necesitan.
texts.en:
Segundo is 65 years old, married, and has three children. He lives with his wife and their youngest child in the Carlos Stein sector of the District of José Leonardo Ortiz, which lies next to the city of Chiclayo. This district is considered to be the most populous in the region and also has the highest poverty rates.

For more than a year, Segundo has been selling fruits and candy from a small street stand located in front of a bus terminal in the city of Chiclayo. His business has been well-received and is frequented daily by many people traveling to the inland towns of the region. He spends all day at his business and uses his earnings to cover his family’s expenses.

Segundo wants to continue his business by purchasing more fruit since there is high demand for this product. In order to do this, he is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN.

Segundo is a hardworking individual who always looks out for the progress and welfare of his family. His coworkers and neighbors consider him to be someone who is honest, responsible, and always willing to help when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Ericka De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Ericka es una joven de 30 años de edad, madre de un hijo, casada, trabaja como técnico evaluador en una empresa privada, pues no fue fácil encontrar trabajo pero nada imposible, aplico mediante curricumlo.
Aun vive en casa de sus padres ya que no tienen el dinero suficiente para poder comprar su propio terreno y poder construir.
Lo que hará con este préstamo es la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros para poder hacer un anexo en el cuarto para lograr estar en mejores condiciones con su hijo. Contenta ya que hará posible esta inversión que espera lograr con los años su propia casa a trabes de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Ericka is a young woman of 30, the mother of one child, and a wife. She works as a technician evaluator for a private company. It wasn't easy to find work, but it wasn't impossible; she applied through a curriculum. She still lives with her parents because she doesn't have enough money to buy her own land and build on it. With this loan she will buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, and iron, among other things, to build an annex to her room to be able to live in better conditions with her son. She's happy because with this investment it will be possible, after a few years, to buy her own home with the help of financing.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, sand, cement, iron, and other materials to build an annex on her room to have a little more space

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng V., 47, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia – an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. V. grows rice to sell with an income of $1 US per day. Her husband produces palm sugar, earning about $3 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

V. is requesting a loan of $800 US to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s studies. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a la producción de tostado de maíz, fideo y arroz, lo cual lo produce artesanalmente, que este arte aprendio de sus abuelos, la Señora antes vivía en alquiler, pero trabajando fuerte logro comprarse una casa que ahora es de ladrillo y adobe, ella vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Que cada mañana se levantan a trabajar y producir tostado y así poder repartir a sus clientas. Actualmente su casa se encuentra a unos 2 kilómetros de la carretera a Quillacollo Cochabamba, a la Sra. Julia le es muy  difícil salir hasta la avenida, pero su esposo tiene un pequeño auto que le ayuda a trasladar su tostado. La señora se siente muy feliz por darle la oportunidad de acceder al crédito con fondos kiva, ya que le permite aumentar de capital y mantener a sus 4 hijos. En la foto se le ve muy contenta ya que se le encontró con las manos en el tostado.
texts.en:
Julia makes toasted corn, beans, and rice, which she produces artisan fashion, an art she learned from her grandparents. She used to live in a rental unit but by working hard, Julia was able to buy a house which, now, is of bricks and adobe. She lives with her husband and 4 children. Each morning Julia rises and goes to work, producing toasted goods to supply her customers. At present, her house is some 2 kilometers from the Quillacollo-Cochabamba highway. It is very difficult for Julia to get her products to the avenue, but her husband has a small car and he helps her transport her toasted goods. She feels very happy to have access to loans with Kiva credit, because it permits her to expand her capital and maintain her 4 children. In the photo, you will see her very content, displaying her toasted products.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING RICE, SUGAR, AND BEANS TO MAKE TOASTED ARTISAN PRODUCTS

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex M. Kibe is forty-nine years old, married, and has five children aged between twenty five years old and fifteen years old. His business office is located near the Koja mosque, in a very busy street in the city centre in Nairobi and is well known by the name Malex real estate. He does real estate and rentals. He has been in this business for the last five years and he says the business is profitable. He says the business is very good and the only major challenge he has is customers not paying rent on time. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to ensure that his business is doing well. He's taking out a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to build a stall to rent out to business people. In the future, he sees himself building another house. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: building a stall to rent

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita S. is from the village of Calabayan Ozamiz City. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Esterlita owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T. is from the town of Banga. She is 39 years old and is married with four school-aged children.

Jocelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seventeen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: The Women´s Bank ¨ Women Of Power¨ Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women members who reside in Pococí, Limón, located in the hot and humid Caribbean region of Costa Rica. This group was formed at the beginning of 2007, however, this will be the members' first loan with Fundación Mujer.  The loan consultant who has been working with this group has described the members as hard-working entrepreneurs with the desire and ability to improve standards of living for themselves as well as their families.  A major limiting factor for the women of this group has been a lack of access to working capital. This loan will help to address this problem. 

The members of this group are involved in various productive activities including clothing sales and agricultural activities. Isabel Guzmán A. has a business selling clothing. For her female clients, Isabel offers both casual and intimate clothing. She also offers men´s and children´s clothing to her clients, most of whom are acquaintances who live in her neighbourhood.  Isabel plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of more clothing items which she plans to sell at a margin in order to earn a profit.

Leyla G. C. is involved in agricultural activities such as the rearing and selling of pigs and cows. She plans to use this loan to finance the purchase of a calf, animal feed, and if there is any money left over, she hopes to purchase a piglet.

loans.use: For the purchase of animals, animal feed, and clothing to sell

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Luisa; ella tiene 65 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 Hijos; La socia  es propietaria de un restaurant turístico que queda ubicado en una de las calles de la ciudad de Cusco llamada Recoleta, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m ,ella prepara diferentes platos típicos de la ciudad de Cusco como chairo ( es como una sopa con verduras),rocoto relleno, lechón al horno ( chancho al horno) entre otro platos variados, la socia quiere mejorar el restaurant y ampliar.  La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el restaurant para comprar utensilios para la cocina.


Los otros socios  se dedican la costureria, venta de ropa en el centro comercial, negocio de llamadas, restaurant.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “KILLA” communal bank; This bank is located in the Wanchaq district, which is part of the Cusco province and department.


The member is Luisa; she is 65 years old and is married and has 6 children; the member owns a tourist restaurant which is located on one of the streets of the city of Cusco called Recoleta, she works from 8:00 a.m until 9:00 p.m, she prepares different dishes which are typical of the city of Cusco such as chairo ( it is a soup with vegetables), stuffed hot peppers, roasted suckling pig among other various dishes, the member wants to improve and expand the restaurant.  The member is requesting the loan to set up the restaurant by buying utensils for the kitchen.


The other members work as a seamstress, sell clothes in the commercial center, have a calling business, and a restaurant.
The member is grateful to whoever forms part of this dream through these means and promises to complete the payment installments in the established period.

loans.use: to set up the restaurant by buying utensils for the kitchen.

loans.name: Greysy Mayela

texts.es:
la señora Greysy Mayela V. tiene 22 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un hijo. Greysy vive en casa de sus padres desde hace 22 años,  logro sacar sus estudios secundarios y quedo embarazada y a medida que a pasado el tiempo no ha podido tener un trabajo entonces decidio dedicarse a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas, dicho negocio le a dado para cubrir con los gastos de su hijo.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña y cal, desea tener reserva de leña y maiz ya que la epoca esta muy lluviosa por la zona y se es dificil conseguir leña y maiz.
 
sus deseos es tener un trabajo extra que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Greysy Mayela Vásquez, 22, is a single mother of a son.  She has lived in her parents’ house for the past 22 years.  She managed to finish secondary school but became pregnant and as time went by was unable to get a job.  She decided, therefore, to go into tortilla making and this business has provided income sufficient to cover her son’s expenses.

She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder.  She wants to have firewood and corn in reserve because during this rainy season in the area it is very difficult to get either of these products.

Her wish is to have an extra job that will allow her to improve the quality of life for herself and her son.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, lime powder and water.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Communal Bank "Miraflores," located in the district of Pilcuyo, in the province of Ilave and the department of Puno. She is 26 years old, single and has no children. She completed secondary education. 

Ana is a new member of the bank and just began working with Manuela Ramos a few days ago. She is asking for a loan of 500 Peru Nuevos Soles, which will allow her to increase the merchandise in her business of selling retail groceries, such as a variety of sodas. Her dream is to have a restaurant/bar. Learning about how the Communal Bank works has had a profound impact on Ana.

loans.use: Increase the merchandise of her grocery and soda store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio trabaja con Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 1996, el es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable,  anteriormente pagaba su cuota en forma semanal  por esa razón tiene con nosotros  varios  créditos.
Gracias a su buena administración obtuvo buenas  ganancias que le ayudaron a ampliar su local comercial y su vivienda.
 Con este crédito piensan comprar algunos elementos de trabajos y el saldo usara  para  materia prima especialmente para abastecer las necesidades de fin de año, como siras, cervezas, vinos, lácteos y otros.
Su deseo más adelante es el de trabajar a mayor escala y poner una Confitería en un lugar más céntrico y de mayor  tránsito.
texts.en:
Antonio has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 1996.  He is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He used to make his loan repayments weekly which is why he has a number of loans from us.

Thanks to his good management, he has obtained good profits which have helped him to expand his commercial premises and his house.

He plans to use this loan to buy some work items and the balance will be used to buy materials to supply end-of-year needs such as cider, beer, wine, dairy products, etc.

His wish for the future is to work on a bigger scale and to set up a patisserie in a more central location with more traffic.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: beer, soda, wine, dairy products and cider.  Products which sell well over the end-of-year season

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon C. is from the town of Surallah. He is 57 years old. Ramon is married. To make a living, Ramon owns & operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ramon works hard to provide for all his family's needs. 

Ramon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ramon has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ramon is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like fertilizers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: Habsamet

texts.en:
Habsamet K. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His older two daughters both attend university and his youngest daughter attends a local high school. Habsamet is a very gentle and open-minded man.

Habsamet operates a taxi service during winter months in his town. He has been engaged in this business since 2008, and has gained much experience within a short period of time. In addition, he works in the Cu-Arna partnership to supplement his earnings. His earnings have enabled him to pay his two children's tuition fees. He says, "although my business earnings are not enough to provide my children's education fees, I work very hard to make it work." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase necessary spare parts for his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary spare parts

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: La señora Gabriela M. Mújica tiene 28 años de edad y es originaria de la localidad San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar hermoso donde sus aguas son conocidas como termales o aguas de azufre. La señora Gaby como es conocida por sus amigas y vecinos estudio como técnico en enfermería, aunque dice que no termino su carrera porque se caso muy joven y su esposo ya no la dejo seguir estudiando ya que también tenían a su primer hijo y se le dificultaba pagar los gastos de su escuela y los gastos de su niño. Gaby como le gusta que le digan, vende productos de belleza y para el hogar por catalogo, ella tiene con esta actividad mas de 4 años comenta que ella empezó a trabajar para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, ella sale a vender a diferentes escuelas a las maestras y a sus vecinas, comenta que ella tiene esta actividad gracias a su suegra porque ella fue quien la invito a trabajar en la venta de productos por catalogo. La señora Gaby esta pidiendo un crédito a la Fundación para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de productos de belleza y para el hogar, Ella esta casada con el señor Ernesto el cual es jornalero, ellos tienen 2 niños de nombres Alejandro de 9 años el cual estudia la primaria y Alonso de 5 años de edad que estudia el jardín de niños. La meta que tiene para su negocio la señora Gaby es hacer un local en su casa ya que tiene espacio y hacer una papelería y venta de regalos ya que cerca de su casa no hay ese tipo de negocio comenta que esta pensando en realizar ese sueño.
texts.en: Gabriela M. Mujica is 28 years old and she is originally from the region of San Jose Purua in the state of Michoacan. It is a beautiful region known for its hot thermal springs. Gaby, as she is known to her friends and neighbors, studied to be a nursing assistant, but she didn't complete her training because she married very young and her husband did not let her keep going. They had already had their first child and it was too difficult to cover the tuition and pay for the baby's expenses. Gaby, as she likes to be called, sells beauty products and household items through a catalogue. She has been in the business for four years and she started out to help her husband with the household expenses. She goes out to sell to the teachers in various schools and to her neighbors. She has this business thanks to her mother-in-law because she was the one who encouraged her to work in the sale of products through catalogues. Gaby requests a loan from Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) in order to invest in the purchase of beauty products and household products. She is married to Ernesto, a day laborer. They have two children, Alejandro who is 9 years old and in primary school, and Alonso who is 5 years old and in kindergarten. Gaby's goal is to set up a store from her house because there is room to accommodate it. She wants to set up an office supply store and toy store.  There are no other businesses like this one near her home and this would be the realization of a dream.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
Luisa Elena P. E. tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, reside en Colonia El Eden en la ciudad de Juticalpa y es integrante del Grupo Solidario Genesis. Luisa se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de las marcas Avon, Flush y Arabela. Ella aprendio este negocio de sus hermana. Su forma de vender es de casa en casa enseñando los catalagos de productos. Trabaja desde las 2:00 pm hasta las 5:00 pm y lo hace desde hace 4 años. Con el prestamo comprara mas cosmeticos como: listick, sombras, esmalte para uñas, lapiz de labios y ojos, polvos para la cara, shampos, etc. Y eso le ayudara a mantener un mayor inventario y podra ofrecerles a sus clientes mas variedad. 

Luisa tiene un problema de salud en sus ojos y su enfermedad se llama Cataratas. Su sueño es poder tener la capacidad economica para tratarse medicamente su problema de la vista y que su negocio le siga permitiendo sostenerse. Ha sido clienta de FAMA por tres ciclos y es una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Luisa Elena P. E. is 34 years old. She is single with no children, and she lives in the El Eden neighborhood of the city of Juticalpa. She is a member of the Genesis Solidarity Group. Luisa works selling cosmetics from the Avon, Flush and Arabela brands. She learned this business from her sister. Her method of selling is from house to house, explaining the product catalogs. She works from 2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m., and she has been doing this work for 4 years. With the loan, she will buy more cosmetics, such as lipstick, eye shadow, nail polish, lip and eye pencils, face powders, shampoo, etc. This will help her maintain a larger inventory and allow her to offer more variety to her customers. 

Luisa has a health problem related to her eyes; her disorder is called cataracts. Her dream is to be able to have the economic capacity to obtain medical treatment for her vision problem, and also that her business will continue to permit her to support herself. She has been a client of FAMA for three loan cycles, and she is a very responsible person.

loans.use: Buying a variety of cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Burulbubu

texts.en:
Burulbubu B. is 56 years old and lives in Emgekchil village with her family. Her husband works as a keeper at the local school. She has nine children; four of them live with their own families while the other five live with Burulbubu and help their parents in farming. 

In 1970, with an initial capital investment of 8,000 KGS, Burulbubu's family began to breed livestock and cultivate land with wheat, barley and holy clover. They worked hard to develop the farm. Because of their hard work, Burulbubu qualified for her first loan from Bai Tushum, which was repaid without any delays. 

Burulbubu will use her loan of 70,000 KGS to broaden her business by buying one cow, one colt, and sheep. With the revenue, she plans to construct a barn for her cattle and hold her daughter’s wedding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase a cow, a colt, and sheep

loans.name: Sergio Enrique

texts.es:
El señor S. E. es trabajador de ENACAL desde hace tres años ocupando el puesto de Operador de Pozo, en el Municipio de Granada, del Departamento de Granada, el es acompañado, su núcleo familiar lo conforma su esposa y cuatro hijos.

Este señor quiere que su familia viva cómodamente en su casa para esto el tiene un sueño que es ir mejorando la infraestructura de su hogar, por tal razón el se está acercando a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para realizar el Mejoramiento de vivienda que quiere y hacer cumplir su sueño que se ha trazado para que su familia viva bien y no pasen problemas cuando entre la época de invierno.
texts.en:
Mr. S. E. has been employed as a Well Operator, by a firm called ENACAL, located in the town of Granada, Granada department, for three years.  He is currently in a relationship and his family consists of his wife and four children.

He would like his family to live comfortably in their house so his dream is to improve the infrastructure of the house.  For this reason he is approaching the CEPRODEL offices to request a home improvement loan that he wants so that he can make his dream of having his family live well and problem free when the winter season comes a reality.

loans.use: For home improvement.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia A., from the village of Osukan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, is 52 years old, married, and has six grown children. To make a living, Dionesia owns and operates a business venture selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business, and plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khashbat

texts.en: Khashbat is 27 years old and lives with his parents and younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in a small wooden house on their own plot of land. His younger sister attends a university. Khashbat used to produce a variety of wooden furniture products including chairs, tables, sofas and wardrobes. Currently he is operating a taxi business in the city using his own car. Khashbat is planning to go to Korea to work under a labor contract. He is requesting a loan to increase his business capital by purchasing some spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señorita. María M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive en la comunidad de Chican en el cantón Paute, este cantón es de clima templado propicio para la siembra de flores, es conocido por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.

María tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.

Ella  labora hace cuatro meses como empleada domestica en una casa de la ciudad de Cuenca, trabaja puertas adentro  de lunes a sábado al medio día, los días sábados viaja a Chican  en donde cría cuyes, chanchos y borregos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años, su crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de una chanchera y en la compra de mas chanchos. Su sueño es viajar a los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Srta. María M. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women). She lives in the community of Chican in Paute Canton. This canton has a temperate climate that is suitable for growing flowers. In addition, Paute is known for its beautiful landscapes. The people engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture.

María is 30 years old, single, and has no children. For the past four months, she has worked as a housekeeper at a home in the city of Cuenca. She works behind closed doors Monday through Saturday until noon. On Saturdays, she travels to Chican where she raises guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep.

María has been a member of the Communal Bank for three years. Her loan will be invested in the construction of a pig pen and the purchase of more pigs. She dreams of traveling to the United States.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and acquire materials to build a pig pen.

loans.name: Lynmar

texts.en:
Lynmar S. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 29 years old. Lynmar is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, buying and raising pigs for resale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lynmar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. 

Lynmar is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

location.town: Santa Cruz, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
One can see life as a fabric into which either golden threads or burlap are woven. For Geraldine L., 35, each thread is valuable as it makes her and her family's lives worth living. Aside from being a micro-entrepreneur, Geraldine is also a wife to Samuel, a car air conditioner technician, and a mother to three children, one of whom is in high school while the other two go to elementary school. Their family lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite. 

Doormat making is Geraldine's main business. She uses scrap cloth to produce beautiful doormats that are sold at prices afforded by her fellow community members. Geraldine has been operating this business for three years now in their home in Dasmarinas. 

Other than doormat making, she is also into direct selling. She brings with her catalogs of the apparel brand Board Walk and other beauty brands, gets orders from customers in the neighborhood, purchases the orders, and delivers the products to the customers. She earns profits out of the commission. Summing it all up, Geraldine earns a net income of 7,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) every month. 

To help her grow her doormat making business, Geraldine decides to loan an amount of 14,000 PHP. She believes that with the entrepreneurial training and spiritual support CCT* gives her, she will be able to channel the loan into appropriate business measures and increase her income. She plans to purchase more cloth in order to be able to produce more doormats. Part of the loan will also go to purchasing more Board Walk products for her direct selling business. 

Given the challenges Geraldine refuses to specifically mention, she then focuses on making the golden threads and the burlap of her life come together to produce a majestic fabric, the fulfillment of her dreams. Simply, this includes profound growth for her business and a college diploma for each of her dear children. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for doormat weaving and home products for resale

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la fabricación de hamacas y matatas, al mismo tiempo trabaja de ordenanza, vive junto a sus 6 hijos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para preparar hamacas, como hilo de seda, cáñamo y manguillos, este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar su producción aumentarla para ofrecer a los clientes.
Ella tiene como objetivo el proveer a sus hijos todo lo necesario para que se superen, se esfuerza todos los días y espera un día verlos en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Martha lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazan. She makes hammocks and chairs and she is also an ordinance worker. She lives with her 6 children. 

She requests a loan to purchase materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread, wood canes, and cuffs. This loan will help her improve production and to increase what she can offer her clients.

Her objective is to provide her children with all that they need to success. She works hard every day and she hopes to see them in better condition one day.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hammocks, such as silk thread, wood canes, and cuffs.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and corn.  

Nenita is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell for her business. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell
